Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Teryl B
Reviews.Content: We booked a condo here back in January, for March 9th. Our family was really looking forward to our 1 night stay in Hana. We wanted to take our time to explore Hana and the drive to Hana. Well, on March 8th, late in the evening, much to our dismay, they closed the road to Hana due to all the rain; there was flash flooding and rock slides. We we unable to go. We called Hana Kai in the morning and they knew that the roads were closed so they gave us a full refund on our condo. I wasn't sure if we would get a full refund or any refund at all, just because some (most) hotels have the policy of once they get your money they've got it. It really helped with our trip to not have to put out extra cash for a night in Lahaina. Even though, we didn't get to stay here, I highly recommend it. Great service! Thank you so much. On our next trip, we will be staying here! We did make a day trip out to Hana a few days later and the grounds of the hotel looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Thin floors and walls!”
Reviews.Author: chicagogirl80
Reviews.Content: Beautiful on Hana bay! It's a decent option if you don't want to pay the ridiculous prices of Travaasa Hana. Although the prices here are also ridiculous for the quality of the building(s)... but it seems your options are limited in Hana. We stayed in room 205, in the mauka building, for one night. The room itself was actually clean, nicely outfitted, and comfortable. There's a nice high ceiling with two fans to keep the air circulating. We had a good view of the waves crashing onto the black gravel beach portion of Hana Bay... it's not a nice swimming beach, but it is nice to see/hear the waves crashing from your room. My complaint and the reason for 2 stars is that the floors creak and the walls are super thin. You can literally hear everything that's going on in the other rooms, in the building and outside. You can hear your neighbors conversations and you can hear them coming and going. Also, the free wifi doesn't really work.. and you're not going to get reception. So expect to be off the grid while you're here, ie. no Yelping! to find local eats =) For $250/night, I'd unfortunately expect a little better. That being said, I knew of this potential when I booked, as it's mentioned in many of the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: MrsPeeps1985
Reviews.Content: The condo was clean and beautiful. Comfy bed and you can hear the ocean at night. Great view even from the building that is further back. You do not need to pay extra for ocean front. Staff was friendly. Grounds are lovely. Walk out to the black sand beach easily. I recommend Dinner at the Cafe Romantica truck and a massage at Luana Spa retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gittinsj
Reviews.Content: I decided that instead of rushing the drive on the Hana Highway, I would find a place to stay in Hana. There aren't a huge number of options, at least compared to other parts of Maui. I found one room available for one night, and decided to reserve the room. When I first arrived, I wasn't sure what to make. The landscaping along the path to the check-in office was the first indication that this place was well taken-care of. The check-in process went very smoothly, and the woman was very friendly. I got to the room, and was truly impressed. Plan on bringing supplies, as there was a fridge, microwave, and oven available, along with other amenities. The bed was extremely comfortable. There was no TV, but there was wireless internet. My room was oceanview, and the view was great. I loved sitting on the balcony and looking out at the ocean. There was only a fan, but I left the door open during the night to enjoy the ocean sounds, and had no problems with the temperature in the room. I was overall very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful view, but thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMomma
Reviews.Content: While exploring Hana we stayed in rooms 101 and 202 at the Hana Kai Maui. Lots of positive things about this place. We thought the location was great and loved the large full-size windows and sliding door to look out at the ocean from the bed (room 202, not 101. The bedroom in 101 faces the street). Though small and basic, the kitchen had everything we needed and they supplied delicious coffee every morning for the coffeepot. Bed linens were top notch, and everything felt very clean. They supply a very nice gas grill out front to use and they do the clean up. The only negative at Hana Kai was the very thin walls. You could hear everything through the walls, and I mean everything. Thankfully, everyone took note of the "quiet hours". Not fancy, but a cool place to stay in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Hana.”
Reviews.Author: Scurry49428
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Hana. We had a great view of the ocean from our room and the sunrise was fantastic. The room was clean and the check-in and check-out process was easy. We only stayed one night and we were not there very long but we did enjoy are time. There was a nice kitchen and dining area. We ended up getting pizza and bringing it back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai 1: â€œWaikaloaâ€�”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLance
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days before moving on to Napili during March 2011. Booked Hana Kai 1 and it looks exactly like the pictures. The room really is fun and stereotypically Hawaiian. We had a killer view and an enormous lanai; almost felt like we should've had more people with us...almost. The girl who checked us in was informative i.e. had a wealth of knowledge about local food etc and was friendly enough. The room is huge, kitchen well equipped, bed comfy and everything is really great...with one caveat; if you have noisy upstairs neighbors....you WILL know about it. Quite a bit of salt spray crusted on the windows but I guess it's the price you pay for the location. There are fantastic beaches nearby and the town itself is very "local", in a good way. Stores have limited stock so if cooking is your plan come prepared i.e. pick up stuff on the way from the airport. However, there are many roadside "setups" with traditional plate lunches (love the Teriyaki) and some good restaurants too. Overall I would recommend (actually checking availability at the moment) but would consider another room...maybe. Though it wouldn't take tooo much arm twisting to get me to stay in the same:)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view in heavenly Hana”
Reviews.Author: Margaret F
Reviews.Content: We just arrived and could not be more pleased with our condo. Clean, well appointed unit with a balcony overlooking the black sand beach with its pounding surf. Hana is a quiet place, just what we are looking for. Having done a day trip to Hana in the past, which was lovely but tiring, we were thrilled to get out in Hana, go for a walk and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, beautiful people”
Reviews.Author: RobinandChris
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hana Kai twice 2007 1 night, and 2009 for 8 nights). #2 (Popolani) is a great room for a couple. sliding doors open to allow the sounds of the ocean in, and what a view! One thing I must mention is Hana is for those that want to relax and really understand the "real" maui. We enjoyed "talking story" with Stanley, and Velly was always friendly and answered our questions about the area. We left notes for our housekeepers each day, and they wrote back :) We were happy to get to know them through our daily writings. The local people are very friendly and one day we saw a handwritten sign that simply said,"MALASADAS". We found the house and a local woman was using a propane deep fryer to make this sweet donut type confection. 1 dozen in a paper bag shaken with sugar. We bought 2 dozen and left 1 bag at the desk for the staff. They were delicious! If you go to the islands please remember to conserve water and be mindful of the fragile septic systems...be respectful and remember you are a guest on their island. "No worries" :) One note: upon arrival leave your bags in the car since the office is on the bottom floor. It was something we found amusing as we watched people carrying all their luggage down the steps and then back up again. Once we found Hana, and Hana Kai the "tourist" locations no longer appeal. We will be back again...soon.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: lynhe
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here last month (January 2012) and it was absolutely heaven. Every day was perfect, even on the last day when it rained a bit. We stayed in #1 and even though there might be a little noise from those above us (mostly moving suitcases in and out), it was fine. We loved the shower, the bed and furniture was comfy, and we loved watching the sunrise from and eating on our lanai. There were so many windows we felt like we were outside all of the time! No better place to destress! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet spot!”
Reviews.Author: Belizefans
Reviews.Content: We spent one night there and had an upper floor room with an awesome view of the black sand beach from the lanai - very nice room with great decor, a well equipped kitchen with shutters that open onto the lanai and a really comfortable table & chairs on the lanai to enjoy the view and your meal at the same time! If you're staying longer than a night, there is a nice big open deck and lawn right by the beach with a big grill - that's probably what we'd do if we went back, since the restaurant selection in Hana for dinner is just a couple of places and there's a good grocery store. Overall, we were very happy - a welcome home after the road to Hana all day!

Reviews.Title: “hana's best?”
Reviews.Author: MushroomTraveller
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere to stay after driving the road to Hana with the return trip the next day and Hana Kai fit the bill perfectly. Large single bedroom condo with kitchen, living room and lani looking out over the black sand beach and ocean â€“ lots of dark wood gave a â€˜richâ€™ feel and very quiet apart from the sea! Not a spotless condo but very acceptable. We could have spent a 2nd night in the condo but the weather was decidedly worse on that side of the island so moving on was not difficult. Like: condo wood, road to Hana. Dislike: weather.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai is excellent and affordable in Hana”
Reviews.Author: gapcmp
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently spent two nights at the Hana Kai in Maui. Overall the accomodations were excellent. What a great view of Hana Bay off our third story lanai. The property is clean, modern, affordable and the staff were as helpful as they could possibly be. There are no elevators and parking is tight.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding View and Unit 5 Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Bkrabbs
Reviews.Content: Second trip to Hana with small kids.First stay at Hana Kai-Maui. Spent two nights in unit 5 (KAAHUMANU) and unit is even nicer than pictures. Top quality finishes, with a high end touch.Well worth every cent with a millon dollar view. Very well stocked and spotless.

Reviews.Title: “So not impressed, don't stay here unless you are just planning a one night stay!”
Reviews.Author: Denvercowgirl
Reviews.Content: If you are doing a one nighter in Hana, it is fine. They were rude when my family of four showed up, and I asked for sheets for the futon bed for the kids. They said the room wasn't reserved for 4, and they were going to charge me an additional $60 a night for the room. Are you kidding me? I specifically told the woman I booked the room with I had two young children, and would this complex be ok with them? We were already paying $225 a night for a one bedroom that had not been updated in years, with the tiniest kitchen ever, and no disposal! Then, wenwanted to do a load of wash. They charge $5 to let you use the washer and dryer, but they only let you use cold water and only the short cycle, which D does not get things clean. I asked if we could do a longer wash cycle because we had hiked in the pouring rain and mud up to the falls and had dirty clothes, and she said no! Rude again. Would not recommend this facity to a friend, and wod never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Unplug in Hana”
Reviews.Author: sullyryno
Reviews.Content: If you are trying to escape the crowds of tourists and looking for peace and quiet on your vacation, this is the place to stay. If you need a TV or feel naked without your iPhone or Blackberry service, you probably don't want to stay here. We loved our 2 nights in Hana, but there is not much to do at night. Daytime there are numerous day trips to waterfalls or lava tunnels, but with designated quiet time each night and a shortage of restaurants and bars, you'll likely find yourself going to bed early each night. The condos were large with great kitchens, views, and ammenities. I would recommend staying here and taking advantage of the kitchen and local grocery store to stock up the kitchen and cook, rather than eating at the few overpriced places in town.

Reviews.Title: “Feel one with Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Joseph G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at Hana Kai Maui in November 2011 in the Popolani studio #2. It was perfect for two people, with a nicely equipped kitchen and comfortable bed. The rooms on this level boast immediate proximity to the beach - just yards above a gorgeous black sand beach with crashing waves and wonderful sunrises and sunsets, and a beautiful wide lanai from which to enjoy it. But my favorite thing was that the sliding doors opened apart to create a double-wide opening, and the louvered windows in front the front of the unit allowed the gorgeous ocean breeze to flow right through the studio. As you drifted off to sleep, you could easily imagine your bed being directly on the beach. Good lighting and a warm color palette tied the overall ambiance together. Three nights was a really good number to stay on the Hana side - it allowed us time to explore Waianapanapa State park and Haleakala National Park with plenty of time to lollygag. For us, another night or two in Hana would have been great, but less than three would have left us feeling we didn't really see this side of the island. Perhaps most importantly, this side of the island really felt like you might imagine Hawaii. And Hana Kai Maui allowed you to feel close to the earth. During our multi-week stay on the island, we also stayed at three of the top four resorts on southern and western Maui, but truthfully, the days I look back on with the greatest affection were our days at the Hana Kai Maui. I look forward to returning some time in the future. Our favorite place to get food in Hana was the little Thai Food place - follow the little handwritten signs - it's across from the school ball field. Joe G - Pittsburgh PA

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai- a little bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: travelling_monkeys
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights in room 203. Beautiful place with amazing views of the black sand beach. The room was nicely furnished and very comfortable with a large lanai overlooking the ocean and a smaller one fronting the street. This was our first trip to Hana and we loved it - highly recommend to anyone making the trip that they stay 1+ nights. Having the extra time allowed us more time hiking, exploring the area and most importantly, more time to just relax. The ocean breeze totally cools off the room (no air conditioning needed). The only con I can think of is that the rooms all have lots of screens on doors, windows, etc. so if your neighbors also have everything opened up (or are loud doorway talkers) it can feel like they are in your room. We briefly experienced this but overall, the place, and other guests, are very quiet and mellow. We plan to go back and hopefully stay in Hana (at the Hana Kai) at little longer.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Sea Views”
Reviews.Author: campbell95008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Unit 101. This is not a Hilton or a Westin, nor did we expect it to be. The views are amazing. Having a relaxing trip to Hana without being rushed to return to the resorts same night is priceless. Only three miles from the black sand beach and within minutes from red sand beach. The rooms were of decent size, the kitchen was well equipped and the front desk staff was friendly. I read the guest book in our room and there were many happy guests who stayed here in the last 90 days.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice find in Hana!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyandMike
Reviews.Content: We are SO glad we stayed in Hana for two nights on our most recent trip to Maui. We have done a day trip before but it was too rushed. Hana isn't for everyone but it is definitely for us! We considered splurging on the higher-priced Hotel Hana Maui but I'm so glad we didn't. The Hana Kai condos were very nice and we were especially thankful for the well-equipped kitchen, which we wouldn't have had at the hotel. We stayed in Unit #1 Waikoloa, which had a nice kitchen and an updated bathroom. We also appreciated the room divider which allowed our four year old to sleep on the fold-out sofa bed in the living room while we were in the bedroom. The view here is soooooo amazing and the sound of the waves will lull you to sleep. A few negatives: Musty smell but I imagine this is pretty hard to prevent in such a lush, damp climate; not much access to food -- BRING YOUR OWN! We stopped at Mana foods in Paia (which is a wonderful market) for fresh fish to grill for our first night in Hana. Next time we would bring enough food for both nights. We had thought that we would be able to go out the second night but the only restaurant in town (excluding trucks which we tried to visit but couldn't find an open one) got such bad reviews that we decided to grill hot dogs at our condo. Overall an awesome time in Hana and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “an unforgettably relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: orpheus123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon for 2 nights to break up the long road to Hana from Lahaina and I'm so glad we did. I will never forget the absolute relaxation to be had from merely sitting in the comfortable lounge with a book listening to the sounds of the waves. There are mosquito netted outer doors so you can sit even late at night with the doors open. We didn't miss having a TV, but free wifi was good for staying connected. The apartment was very clean and the kitchen well stocked with the equipment you'd need. Complimentary coffee was most welcome in the morning when we watched the sun coming up from our private lanai. The surroundings are beautifully kept, and the access to the black pebble beach was a nice feature. We saw that there were communal garden tables and chairs and a barbecue which would be nice if you were in a big group. I really cannot fault this property, although Hana is a very small town with limited shops (a whole 2 options for dinner - one of them being really pricey!!) so its hard to imagine staying for that long. That said, it's got everything you need. Make sure you check out the thai place near the school for lunch - run by thai people and the best Pad Thai I've had for a very long time!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to unwind and relax.”
Reviews.Author: 403travler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 206, and we were thoroughly impressed with how well stocked the unit was. Nearly oceanfront location was amazing, especially at night. No TV, but we actually appreciated that. Hana is a very relaxing place and this condo was the perfect home away from home complete with espresso machine, WiFi and tons of beach stuff. Can't say enough good things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View, Spacious Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: gorjon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found the Hana Kai Maui to be a great value. We had six rooms, counting the bathroom and patio overlooking the ocean. The staff was highly professional, making check-in quick and efficient. Several pages of descriptions were emailed to us ahead of our visit. Pay close attention to these, as we found them to be helpful and accurate. We would definitely stay here any time we go to Hana. Be sure to request an ocean view, and of the two buildings, the once closest to the ocean provides the best vista. One tip: bring breakfast food! There is no place in Hana to eat breakfast at a reasonable price. The Hotel Hana-Maui is beautiful, but its breakfast will cost about $18. We were not adequately prepared, but luckily we had picked up some banana bread from one of the several roadside stands and had that with the coffee provided by the Hana Kai. Oh, and don't miss a hamburger at Tutu's, especially if you've just driven in from the west, as the simple food at Tutu's tastes wonderful when you are hungry. Unfortunately they don't open early enough for us at breakfast (9 am or so).

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love Hana Kai”
Reviews.Author: Zorah E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011. Got married in Hana with our 2 children and 15 other of our closest friends and family. We all stayed at Hana Kai and had an amazing time! We stayed in Room 202. Loved the fresh flowers and the cleanliness of the entire property. Our room had everything we needed. The view was extraordinary and watching the sun rise every morning was breathtaking. We stayed for 3 nights, but wish that it was much longer. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the zen jungle”
Reviews.Author: Kmryan1985
Reviews.Content: This condo building is stunning. We stayed in unit one. It had a massive private deck that overlooked the black pebble beach. The beach isn't a swimming beach as there is no real sand and the rip tide is dangerously strong - but the sound the water makes pushing and pulling the pebbles back and forth is like no other. Our room was huge and mostly glass so were able to enjoy the sea breeze and ocean sound very easily. The full kitchen was great, wish we had been able to put it to better use. Unfortunately there are only two store in town and they are not well stocked. Next time we will pack a cooler with meal making items. The bathroom was outstanding in this unit. Massive tile shower with glass door, you could fit about 6 people in there if you really wanted to! Bath amenities to use included Ola products, organic and Hawaiian made, and soft, fluffy Egyptian cotton towels. The bedroom area was great as well. Our bed was super comfy, the Egyptian cotton linens were luxurious and the pillows just right. No tv here, but there was wifi (however you had to sit in a certain spot on the bed and don't you dare move, and board games. The innkeepers are not nearly as friendly as the informational book stresses they are, most locals in Hana don't offer a warm and fuzzy greeting overall. The town is sleepy, the jungle is lush, coastline haunting and this condo is a great place to lay your head at night. I sincerely hope we can stay in unit 1 again.

Reviews.Title: “Two Bedroom Condo”
Reviews.Author: marylou m
Reviews.Content: The two bedroom condo was lovely and spacious. There was a sewage odor coming from the kitchen sink, especially when I used the dishwasher. The staff did not smell anything. My husband had to get pretty cranky to get a credit for the third night. We did not stay the third night because of the odor.

Reviews.Title: “Stay more than one night”
Reviews.Author: westyfree
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, wished we could have stayed longer. Tip: If you're only staying one night, start out early on the Hana Highway so you can spend more time in the Hana Kai. Pros: Idyllic location. Room was clean, well-maintained and comfortable with beautiful furniture, fully stocked kitchen with high-end appliances. Large balcony with ocean view. Ocean waves and cool breezes to lull you to sleep at night. Inn was fully booked but we had no issues with noise from neighbouring rooms. Cons: Free wifi signal was very weak so we gave up making a connection after six attempts.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in Hana”
Reviews.Author: DHCDB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our honeymoon in order to break-up the road to Hana experience. Hawaii, Maui, Hana we found expensive in general but I believe that the Hana Kai gives good value for money in Hana. It gives you the solid foundation of being more of a hotel as opposed to a guest house - which I'm sure are all lovely in Hana - but with the Hana Kai at least if you have a bad room you have a possibility to change it (assuming its not fully booked). Hotel staff were freindly and helpful, the black sand beach is great, so are the fish ponds in the little garden. The shops are close by too which is handy. The rooms were lovely, I would echo other peoples reviews about noise travelling through - but to be fair to the Hana Kai, they do ask guests to respect quiet time and really, if you've made the long trip on the road to Hana, you pretty much want to sleep once you get there! The crashing waves at night are a great soundtrack. Kicthen was well fitted and they had baking soda in the fridge, which was needed after all the mosquito bits from the waterfalls (baking soda is a recommended remedy)! Also in the room were useful books, maps and board games for fun. The room was spacious and the bedroom very nicely decorated. Place was all clean and tidy and well presented. I can't really fault the place and I am glad I chose the Kai over the other hotel in Hana. I guess it really deserves a 4.5 out of 5. Would definately stay again for more than one night and would recommend as the place to stay in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “a mostly great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much thanks to the beautiful ocean view, clean room, extremely comfortable bed and well-maintained furnishings, helpful and friendly staff, walkability to Hana bay & restaurants & groceries & red sand beach. The only negative was the lack of insulation between the upstairs units and ours. We were there three nights and were sometimes bothered by the sounds coming from the units above: voices that carry rather too efficiently and the distractingly loud footfalls of people walking around their unit. Still, I'd recommend this place as an alternative to the higher priced Travesaa.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Victor909
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 206 which is the only independent unit in building. Everything was as promised and a very well appointed unit. Excellent view, comfortable unit. It's nice to see owners that pay attention to the small details as they make or break the experience.

Reviews.Title: “this is a unique place”
Reviews.Author: montrealer2
Reviews.Content: Greetings, We (family of four from Montreal) stayed at Hana Kai Maui for three nights last August. We had the unit 104 located on the upper building. The unit itself is spotless. Probably recently renovated - with great care and taste -. There is one master bedroom including a balcony facing the street. One kitchen (very well equipped), one living room (with pull out sofa bed) and bathroom including a nice storage-like room to put the luggage & clothes. But the "treat" is the main large balcony with direct ocean view. Really impressive and incredible for breakfast and dinner with it's large table and comfortable chairs. There is no A/C in the room, but trust me it's not needed at all, you have the cool ocean breeze during the night and the sound of the waves to put you asleep - much better than A/C - . The propery is directly on a beach (but this is not a beach for swimming) used by some surfers with a nice garden next to the beach. If you want to swim, go to Hana Beach Park or Red Sand Beach. The sunrise views are absolutely delightful (equally nice to the sunsets on the west coast of Maui). This place is so different from anything else you can experiment on Maui island. Remote, secluded, quiet, peaceful, nature, etc... Hana is really living it's own parallel reality to the rest of Maui and i hope it stays like this for many years to come. The Ohe'O gulch and the pools are 45 minutes drive from the property (very slow drive....the road to get there is quite an experience i have to say) and i really recommend to spend the day there including a hike thru the bamboo forest (Pipiwai trail) all the way to the majestic fall (400 feet fall). Another must is the red sand beach which is a 15 minutes walk from the property (not so easy to reach though ... ask for directions and be very careful with the trail as it's very slippery) but spectacular location and this is one beach you can swim since it's protected by a "dragon teeth-like" reef. Of course you have to go as well to the local general store (an attraction in itself) and walk to the fagan memorial - great views from up there -. Hana is a unique & gifted place on earth and Hana Kai Maui a great place to be and enjoy the best of Hana and the surrounding areas. Don't miss it. /Montrealer2

Reviews.Title: “Last minute reservations...”
Reviews.Author: PrimaJohna808
Reviews.Content: We were a bit stuck. I wanted to spend the weekend in Hana with my family but I hadn't done any prior planning. I called the day before we were to head out and the girl who answered the phone was very helpful and friendly. We got the largest suite on the upper corner of the building and the layout was fantastic. I loved the outdoor dining area and the sounds of the waves crashing. There was no TV but we didn't really miss it (but bring a book). The room was beautifully furnished and stocked with basic necessities, dishes, pans, etc and (very pleasantly surprised) board games and wi-fi. I would recommend this hotel to my local and tourist friends. I'll be checking for a room there again next time I make a last minute trip or plan ahead!

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: JxShaw
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the hotel last week. The one bed room we stayed at was clean and adequately equipped. The price was on the expensive side, $250 a night, with a partial view. But at Hana, the choice is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Waves”
Reviews.Author: catherine-alex
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough good things about this gorgeous condo. Our favorite thing, hands-down, was the crashing sound of the waves. It isn't just 'awake to waves'... it's "awake, eat, see, and sleep to" the sound of those waves. They are incredible.... we wish we could bottle that sound and take it home. The condo is incredibly well-appointed. We appreciated the well stocked kitchen, the very helpful visitors guide, the welcome flowers and tote (what a nice thing to do for your guests). When we return to Maui, we're spending a week in your condo. Three nights was not enough. Staying in Hana (three nights) was our favorite part of our 17 night honeymoon in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai Maui - Aloha Oi!”
Reviews.Author: wgfox
Reviews.Content: We spent a heavenly night at the Hana Kai Maui. It was so great to be able to open up the patio doors at night and let the fresh ocean breeze in and to be able to fall asleep to the sound of the surf! We even went down and grilled dinner and ate it out on the lawn so that we could enjoy the ocean. After the sun went down, we walked along the beach and enjoyed the stars which are amazing from Hana! The room was really nice and clean - a very quaint place. The kitchen was well-stocked, and we all fell in love with the body wash and shampoo. My next trip to Maui is going to have to include more than a single night in Hana!

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible place...”
Reviews.Author: mperlich
Reviews.Content: There couldn't be a much more beautiful view than the one you can experience from condo #4 at Hana Kai Maui. Each morning we awoke to a beautiful sunrise and the sounds of the waves hitting the beach. Hana is amazing. The rooms are a bit dated and air conditioning part of the day might have made things a little more comfortable but just look out the window and you can tolerate a lot. Staff are most helpful and service is good. It appears to be one of the nicer places to stay in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 3 Days in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: elainedyan
Reviews.Content: We rented all the rooms at the Hana Kai Maui for my son's wedding and we can't say enough good things about this very special place. First, the site on the black sand beach is one of the best I've ever seen, no structures visible from the patio and lawn, just a tropical paradise. Secondly, the rooms are all different and nice, and the grounds are so lovely, koi ponds, small waterfalls, and tropical plants. We gave all 42 guests continental breakfast every morning in their nice patio, which I prepared in our exquisite 2 bedroom condo. The first of the 3 nights spent there we had a barbecue cooked at their grill on the patio. This patio was a perfect place for all to meet and enjoy each other and the spectacular views. The large grass yard was ideal for the wedding. Of course the wedding co-ordinator bought all the food we needed and worked closely with the hotel staff to make sure everything went smoothly on the wedding day, and it did. The staff were so nice and easy to work with and you could tell they wanted to make this a very special time for us. It couldn't have been better. This is truly a unique location because it's in a residential neighborhood so you feel like you could be tucked away in your own secluded home. We had organized hikes to waterfalls and the seven sacred pools. This happened two weeks ago and friends and family are still calling to say they had so much fun in this wonderful spot in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “We will most definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: hnursement
Reviews.Content: The condo was clean and fantastic down to the last detail. Great views and ammenities. We would recommend it to anyone and when we make it back to Hana, we can"t imagine staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Wildbluyonder
Reviews.Content: For once, the pictures on a hotel website are absolutely truthful. The Hana Kai Maui is a tropical paradise located next to a black sand beach with few sounds except the wind in the palms and the roar of the Pacific surf right outside your room. We stayed four nights in the only privately-owned condo on the property: Room # 206. Contact the owner, Shayla Middleton <shayla@awaketowaves.com> for reservations. The condo is well-stocked with towels, beach gear, kitchen appliances and condiments left by previous guests. It is sparkling clean, well-maintained and beautifully decorated in an "island style" that makes you think of the "old Hawaii" of the 1930s. You might have just arrived from the mainland on one of Pan American Airway's fabled Pacific Clippers! Finally, the view from the lanai is staggering. Don't be surprised if you suddenly burst out singing "Some Enchanted Evening" from "South Pacific!" Hana is the heart of Hawaii. The Hana Kai Maui is a great place to discover it!

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight not much more- an affordable alternative to Travaasa”
Reviews.Author: paulyd04
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Lahaina but took the road to Hana and stayed there one night during our stay- which I would recommend doing versus just driving to Hana and back. Hana is very interesting- a ghost town paradise- 2 restaurants and 2 hotels to choose from (along with some sketchy B&B's.) We wanted to stay at Travaasa but I wasn't going to fork over a grand for a night. With that said, here are some pros and cons... Pros- the view- we stayed in room #4 which was an oceanfront condo and we were literally right on the beach front. All night we left the windows open (which you have to because THERE IS NO AIR CONDITIONING!) and listened to the ocean waves crash onto the black rock. Also staff was friendly and the room had a fully stocked kitchen- even utencils which we utilized for breakfast the next morning- and the utencils and dishes were nice- not crappy old stuff. Also the room was nice and big- full living room, and free WIFI! Cons- majorly (and I mean majorly) outdated. The tub had corrosion around some of the facuets, and the whole place is in dire need of an update. The bed was also very small- almost thought it was a full size instead of a queen. Even though the rooms were clean, there were tiny ants in the bathroom- not too many but several you could see from time to time. All in all it was an ok place, but I wouldn't stay there for more than 1 night again. If i were to stay in Hana again I'd save my money and stay at the Travaasa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ocean view rooms”
Reviews.Author: desotodave
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 101 with my wife and two teen age kids. Nice open air condos with good beds. We stayed here in July and it was fine with no AC, but a plug in fan helped. Ceiling fan in bedroom was stuck on slow speed so it did not help much. The grounds are very nice and there is a nice BBQ area below next to the ocean. Rooms are sparsely equipped and you may need to request more paper products (paper towels, coffee filters), but the staff was helpful. We started our drive to Hana later in the day and stayed two nights. That gave us a full day to drive to seven pools and hike the Pipiwai trail (best hike on Maui). This place was not cheap, but I would stay here again and spend the two days.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: joyousyogini
Reviews.Content: We stayed in #5. It was a 2 bedroom, beautifully decorated oceanfront pl. Nice remodeled bathrooms & kitchen. Huge porch, where we ate while watching the waves. We loved hearing the waves from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Absoulutly AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: tjnkriss
Reviews.Content: we only stayed here for two nights JUne 21-22 and we were worried being from the south that it didnt have ac didnt need it at all . the veiw from Unit 1 was awsome rooms were clean sounds are very relaxing . Great base camp for all the waterfall hiking . My only bad thing is that I didnt stay longer here. one tip when taking a shower close the bathroom window !

Reviews.Title: “Great view. . .”
Reviews.Author: klsage
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rm 206 which had been listed as a luxury condo. While it had some good aspects, it was definitely not luxurious. The main drawback was that the only sleeping area was up a flight of unsafe stairs to the loft, while the bathroom was downstairs near the front door. Otherwise, it was clean and had a small but well-equipped kitchen and a beautiful view of Hana Bay. Another room in this complex would probably have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning..... ABSOLUTELY peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: tammy101
Reviews.Content: Surpassed the reviews and the pics do not do this property justice. Perfect setting for ultra relaxation, my 3 girls LOVED it! Jaw dropping when we entered our room. The view is incredible, ultra comfortable beds and setting. We spent a fair bit of time just taking in the grounds there and enjoying the sound and beauty of the waves from our balcony. Played games rather than watch tv, did not even miss it. Beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “We'll return to Room 201!”
Reviews.Author: Kibedango
Reviews.Content: These are individually owned condos, so that I can only vouch for Room 201 as the most amazing place we've ever stayed. From the spacious lanai, overlooking the black sand beach and witness to awe-inspiring sunsets, to the spacious and comfortable California king bed, one makes discovery after discovery that enhance these rooms even more. The kitchen is fully equipped for cooking, baking or (our favorite) BBQ-ing at the grills one short walk down the hill among the beautiful gardens. There's even an herb garden! The lack of air conditioning is fully compensated for by ceiling fans and the wonderful breezes that waft through the unit. The bedroom can be shut off from the rest of the unit by panels that retract into the walls to accommodate late sleepers. I actually did a video walk-through of Room 201 so we'd never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai 203 - fantastic condo with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: Tall_MD
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night. Very clean, beautifully decorated, fantastic balcony with a great view of the ocean. We pulled out the futon to sleep with the sound of the ocean waves instead of using the bedroom! Fully stocked kitchen was a plus. Close to a few restaurants with a small grocery store down the road. We would choose this unit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, practically on top of the beach”
Reviews.Author: sszimm
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 nights in unit 4-5, a 2-bdr (plus living room, kitchen, lanai, balcony and 2 bathrooms) that was beautiful. Seemed newly renovated and beautifully decorated throughout, from bathroom tilework to furnishings, fully stocked kitchen and perfect setting. Our balcony and lanai looked right over the beach/ocean and the way it was situated we felt nicely private. A beautiful sunrise woke us up each morning. Fans and ocean breezes kept the room comfortable at night for sleeping, in spite of no a/c. Would definitely recommend and return again to spend even more time exploring Hana AND enjoying peaceful time on the lanai and balcony.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful”
Reviews.Author: dmf24
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. rooms was clean and exactly as shown in the photos. stayed in room 107. It was so peaceful sleeping to the sound of the ocean and birds.The staff was very pleasant. Would highly recomend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Hana. There is no a/c but it was fine. they did have a fan but we did not need it in march. there was a nice breeze at night.You get a nice view of the bay from the patio. The beach is not really sand but more small black rocks. It was nice being able to take the drive from kaanapali without rushing or leaving early. We saw all the sights past hana the next morning . we really had no crowds anywhere because of this and no traffic on the back side.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: GloriasTravels
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in Hana a couple day and hike the nearby National Park. Hana Kai was right for our budget (Hotel Hana Maui - way to expensive) and the location from the photos looked ideal. The location is also ideal for the tsunami wave to hit the bay. Yes, we were there for the tsunami. At 9pm the manager called to forewarn us. At 10pm the sirens sounded. We packed up, but was greatful for her call. The one bedroom apartment was very nice. We were kind of worried when read the other reviews. But was nicely surprised when we openned the door. Clean, fresh smelling and fantastic views. We even spotted a whale or two while eating dinner on our lanai. The bathroom was newly tiled, new mattress, and everything was very clean. The staff was overly friendly and very helpful. The windows had all new screens and were huge to let in ocean breezes and lots of light. It was very comfortable sleeping weather with the windows just partially open. Plenty of places to sit and read, and the table had 4 chairs. The kitchen was amply supplied and no bugs. We would stay here again with no worries. The only problem was when other people walked their rolling suitcases on the wood decking it was loud, but we were asleep pretty early (trying to stay on CST).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PAS1242
Reviews.Content: Second time to Maui and first time staying in Hana. We wanted to see more in the Hana area and glad we chose this place. The office staff was very accomodating especially after we had a noisy upstairs neighbor the first nite. The condo was stocked (not with food but two stores near by) well maintained and cleaned every day. Thank you for a wonderful experience and a beautiful view. My husband didn't even miss the AC & TV!!

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai Unit 206 - Perfection!!”
Reviews.Author: bjones71
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to Hana, but our first experience staying at the Hana Kai. We rented unit 206 and it looked exactly like the pictures on the website. Shayla, the owner was very helpful during the reservation process and very accommodating.The unit is very modern with beautiful granite countertops in the kitchen. I would recommend checking into your unit prior to visitng the grocery store due to the unit being pretty well stocked with items left by other visitors (condiments, etc). You may not need to buy so many items. We bought bottled water, but there was already a brita water filter pitcher ready to use. The living room has a pull out sleeper futon/couch. There is no TV in the unit, but they do provide a portable DVD player. The Lanai has a gorgeous view and a very comfy chair to lounge in as well as a nice table for dining. The one bathroom was nice and roomy with a very cool basalt (?) sink. There were also beach necessities provided in the unit such as chairs and boogie boards, and coolers. The upstairs loft is very nice and has a sleep number King size bed. Hana Kai is located on a nice street close to town. My husband, myself and our 6-year old stayed in this unit which worked fine. However, it was so quiet and peaceful I felt like our son may have been a bit too loud at times, as we never heard a peep out of any other guests. I would highly recommened this unit especially for a romatic getaway. The way they have the lighting set up in this unit adds to the romance of it. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit Hana. Having a great condo to come back to at the end of our day was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view of Hana Bay”
Reviews.Author: 103stacey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hana Kai (#104) for the last 3 nights of our 16 day Maui trip. It was a very relaxing way to end our holiday. The sound of the ocean at night and hearing the birds first thing in the morning are sounds we will never forget. The condo itself was clean and the kitchen was well stocked with dishes, utensils, pots etc... Our kids were a little freaked out when we first arrived and had some unwelcome insects crawling around. Being that this is the "tropical" side of the island, we fully expected this and after the first day, there weren't any more insect issues. We kept the screendoors closed to avoid further "guests". We had one extra "guest" each night and I really don't know how he would get in or out. It was the cutest little gecko and he wouldn't bother anyone, he just came in, saw if there was anything for him (insects) and left. No big deal and the kids were ok with him, they thought he was cute. The sofa bed was very comfortable. I highly recommend staying in Hana for at least a night or 2, we were able to venture out each day to do some sightseeing and hiking and not feel rushed. We spent the afternoons swimming at Hamoa Beach which is something not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “worst place we stayed on our trip”
Reviews.Author: chenvolet
Reviews.Content: we stayed at condo 102. objectively i'd give it a 2 star. but compare to my expectation (the $205/night we paid, the photos on the internet, the tripadvisor rating) it is disappointing and is way way way below what we expected. The thing we appreciated is the view from the balcony, we were very close to the ocean and the view was great, of the black sand beach at hana bay. The whole impression of the apartment itself is it's a place that is not well taken care of, paint peeling off everywhere, a bit run-down. we stayed 2 nights there, in retrospect one night in hana is enough and we should have forked the $500+/night (christmas/new year pricing) at the 4 star hotel Hana Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Leave your beach towels, curling iron, and hair dryer at home!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelNV
Reviews.Content: When you leave for vacation there is always a balance of trying to bring the least amount of things while preventing yourself from having to buy things like towels and ice chests. This place had everything - it was so convenient to load the ice chest up for the day and explore. The full kitchen with an ice maker was great. The views were great and the table on the lanai was very nice. We ate breakfast at the condo every day. It was the perfect location for exploring Hana and beyond - so much to do. The locals were so friendly! It would receive 5 stars if only the stairs were a bit easier to get down in the morning when you had to use the bathroom! Not bad - just had to be "awake". The owners really do a nice job - place was clean, nice island decor, wonderful flower arrangement, nice little gifts left for us...I can see why they have so many return customers!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy home away from home”
Reviews.Author: boekelheide
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two days after a drive down the Road to Hana. It was our homebase for excursions in that area, so we wouldn't have to drive all the way back to Tourist Town across the island. (I highly recommend doing this, by the way -- it really let us see a lot more of the sights on the eastern side of Maui.) After half a week in the hustle of Ka'anapali, this condo was a great place to put up our heels and cozy up for a while. The kitchen had everything we needed to make a couple of comfort meals for ourselves, which we enjoyed on the lovely patio overlooking Hana Bay. At night the sound of the ocean lulled us to sleep. Two caveats: There was no A/C, and if it hadn't been early December I bet the strategically placed fans would have had trouble keeping up with the heat and humidity. Also, don't plan on long comforting warm showers, or even a relaxing bath -- the teensy water heater for the unit runs out pretty quickly...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Puernux
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in Hana and did some hiking and swimming. Not many choices for staying in Hana, and this was a relatively nice place. We stayed in Room 1 - great view, nice lanai, wonderful room overall. My wife loved Hana, but I'll stay in South Maui at the beach next time.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Hana but definitely not 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: Mauigirl808
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made a last minute decision to drive around the east half of maui with an overnight stay in Hana. We were able to get the last available room (No. 105) at the Hana Kai Maui. While our stay was not unpleasant, I guess I would expect more for $200/ night. Pros: The room was very clean and was ready when we checked in. The woman at the front desk was efficient and made sure we knew were the local restaurants were located.The bathroom had a very unique tile feature, the bed was comfortable, and even though this was an older building, the room had been upgraded so you don't feel like you are in a 1970's apartment. Also, there was free Wifi. Cons: The building we were in (there are two) had very thin walls and ceilings. The refrigerator was noisy at times and the stove, while very clean inside, was showing signs of rust. Also, the front door and the doors to the lanai are louvered. This can be nice because it lets in the fresh air and you can hear the sound of the ocean and the birds in the morning. As we were on the first floor, we could also hear the cars in the parking lot, suitcases bumping up and down every step as they're dragged up and down the staircase, people talking on their cell phones to their friends and relatives back on the mainland telling them what a wonderful time they were having, chairs and tables being shoved across the floor and as one reviewer said "elephant feet." It's amazing how much noise some people can make just walking across the room. I wouldn't mind this so much during the day, but at 6:30 in the morning all of this was a bit annoying. Ah, well, these people were here on vacation and spending their money so what the heck! Was all this worth $200 per night? Probably not, but this is Hana and there is not a lot of competition so you are going to have to pay a little more. My suggestion - just pay it, accept it, and enjoy yourself. Relax, you're in Hawaii! Also, If you come to the Hana Kai Maui, try to get an upper floor room. You'll probably experience much less noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great balcony with gorgeous views, very friendly staff, clean & comfy inside.”
Reviews.Author: bubblesque
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2-year-old and I spent one night here to break up the long drive from Kihei and I am glad we did. We stayed in #207 and I was pleasantly surprised. Sometimes things online look too good to be true, but Hana Kai Maui lived up to the photos and descriptions online. The whole place was clean and nicely furnished and the small kitchen was well-appointed. The bed was quite comfortable too. What we all liked the best was the big balcony and watching the ocean. Since this building is the one closer to the road, you do get some of the other building in your line of sight. I guess that's the difference between 'ocean front' and 'ocean view'. The grounds here are well kept, with koi ponds that my daughter loved looking into as well as lounge chairs, umbrellas and little tables on the lawn that leads to the nearby black sand beach. The only thing that disappointed me about our stay was that the nearest beach had a fair amount of trash on it. Much of it looked like stuff that had washed ashore from elsewhere, so I don't know if the hotel can do anything about that, but it was definitely too bad.

Reviews.Title: “If I could rent a room and live here, I would.”
Reviews.Author: Sugrrrplum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room #2, front and center. Great view of the beach, and we could hear the rocks moving with the incoming waves. It was very relaxing. We loved Hana more than anything else we did on our trip. Could have stayed longer! This was my second favorite place to stay on Maui, only because the first place we stayed allowed for more privacy. This is a great base for seeing Hana. Its a walk to the red sand beach and short drive to Waianapanapa and Oheo Gulch. My husband loved the more aggressive wave action at Hamoa Beach. We stopped at Mana for groceries in Paia before we came so we were able to have all our meals and cocktails at Hana Kai or while out hiking. However, there were PLENTY of options for food in the area. You will not go hungry if you have cash on you. If we visit Maui again, we WILL stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Shapira
Reviews.Content: If you expect a 5-star, then this could be disappointing. The location is great and for Hana, this hotel is one of the nicest. Overall, it was a pleasant stay. The bed is amazingly comfortable!!! Try to make some time to enjoy the ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandGuy01821
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to drive to Hana while on Maui and took the advice of others to stay at least one night and not be rushed. We looked online for a place that would allow a one night stay and the Hana Kai fit the bill. I was able to call and make a resevation easily. When we arrived the staff was friendly and helpful.. our unit, 105, was clean and comfortable. Got a great breeze through the screen door to the deck. The beach that abuts the grounds of the hotel was really beautiful, as was the sunrise! We sat out in chairs on the beach in the late evening dark and marvelled at the stars. Do yourself a favor and shop in Paia before setting out for Hana, as the grocery options are limited. I will add that there are no shortage of roadside eateries that offer a lot of great food though!! Also there is no TV here, similar to many facilities in the area. Really, did you come to Hana to watch TV? :-) We would recommend Hana Kai and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed another night.”
Reviews.Author: Mushy187
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of travelers on Maui we wanted to take the road to Hana while on our Honeymoon. The road itself is an incredible experience with poster-perfect views. The town of Hana was a great escape from the resort filled areas on other parts of the Island. In order to avoid feeling rushed on the road to Hana we decided to stay a night in town, and I now wish we had done at least one more night. There is a tremendous difference between the sun-drenched heat and sandy beaches near Kaanapali and the rain-cooled forests of Hana that it is easy to forget that the two exist on the same Island. The Hana Kai is a perfect place to make you forget. While we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly everywhere we went in Maui, I don't think our experience would have been complete without the night we spent at the Hana Kai. The room itself (#102) was just what we expected from the pictures, but the pictures couldn't do justice to the atmosphere you can experience from the balcony. Whether it was the relaxing sounds of the water washing up on the black sand beach***, or the unforgettable sunrise the next morning the views and sounds from that balcony will last with me forever. I had some trouble booking the room online (my banks fault...not the resort), and the staff was very accommodating in helping me sort out the problem. My GPS also struggled to find the resort, but the town is small enough that it didn't delay our arrival very long. The kitchen had everything we needed to eat our only "home cooked" meal of the entire trip, but if you do plan on using the kitchen for an extended stay I would have to recommend that you pick up some groceries before you arrive in Hana. The stores in town have a few items, but if you're even a little bit picky you might have trouble finding what you're looking for. I didn't personally take any exception to this, but for those who might, our room did not have a television. The room also didn't have AC, but the breeze off of the ocean was plenty to make the room very comfortable (also the temperature on this side of the island is totally different). It does rain consistently here, so in case you are driving a convertible (or a jeep with the top down), you may want to remember to put the top back up before you call it a night. There is a nice little grill area both on the upper level, and on the lower level. Again, we had a great time everywhere we went on Maui, but in hindsight I would have loved to have spent at least one more night at the Hana Kai! ***My wife made me promise that if I write a review on the Hana Kai, that I must mention (warn others) about the black sand beach. Outside of the ocean being present, there is very little similarity to a sugar sand beach. The sand (rocks) have a little bite to them when you're walking and the rocks in the water can be very slippery (and painful depending on your level of clumsiness). I did actually lose my wedding band trying to help my wife maintain her balance (also a note to newly married men, apparently you are not supposed to wear your wedding band in the ocean), and for all of these reasons combined I am writing these words of warning regarding the black sand beach outside of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “timeless paradise on Hana Bay”
Reviews.Author: metalmaiden
Reviews.Content: Old Hawaii; simple, timeless, breath taking. What a find! Situated on a black stone beach on the bay all rooms have views from their balconies. We were treated to a (nearly) full moon rise and a sunrise over the bay. Spectacular! The area is lush, green and tropical. The hotel has landscaped with the lush vegetataion and flowers and intersperced it with coy pools and little waterfalls. You are surrounded by the sounds of water not only from the landscaping but the ever present waves breaking on the stoney beach. The sound of the water is a lullaby with which to get a fantasic night's sleep. (there are quiet hours here so nothing does disturb your sleep!) The only other sounds you hear are the birds songs and the breezes rustling the palm leaves. They also have laundry facilities. This was our mid-way point and we packed light so it was nice to have a (jumbo) load done at a minimal price. There are no TVs but you wont miss it--just sit on your balcony and enjoy! Rooms have kitchenette that ar completely equiped. If you are doing the "road to Hana" trip stop here and spend a night (or 2 or 3!) for a peaceful relaxing recharge and enjoy what this area has to offer instead of rushing the trip all in one day! Also try the fish tacos at Braddah Hutt don't the road. They will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “We had the best room in the place.”
Reviews.Author: JudyGinAZ
Reviews.Content: We decided at the last minute to drive the Hana Highway and stay overnight before catching our flight out of Kahului. We were able to get suite #3, which is at the corner of the lower building, with an amazing view of the cove and the black pebble beach. Although these are not the most recent vintage, they are very clean, very comfortable, and the setting is wonderful. We had everything we needed for a perfect stay. One bit of advice: stay longer than one night!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyite
Reviews.Content: The other reviews that caution you about whether Hana is right for you bear repeating. We had done the Road to Hana on a previous visit to Maui and wanted to spend the night. From the road, the hotel has an almost motel look. The girl at check-in was obviously bored with her job. We stayed in #201, a nice but aging condo with a beautiful view. The day we arrived was pretty hot and humid and even with the fans in the room, we needed to keep on the lanai until dark when it cooled off. Like all hotels on Maui now, the hotel is a non-smoking property, which is fine but my wife will smoke two or three cigarettes a day and she was directed to a fruit bush between the two buildings as their smoking area. The big problem is that the fruit tree attracts a lot of bees. Not very welcoming. They advertise wi-fi in all the rooms, but the connection was spotty to the point of being unreliable. The rooms in Hana are scarce so you won't find value here. There's no competition, so they will charge more (about $300) than the room would be worth anywhere else. Our efforts to get a slightly later check-out were unsuccessful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the great finds of all time”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Traveler10025
Reviews.Content: The room was spectacular - beautifully furnished, gourmet kitchen, extraordinary views. We've stayed in MANY top hotels/inns around the world and this easily ranks as one of my favorites. i would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient Hana Kai”
Reviews.Author: water7996
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in July in Unit 207. Beautiful view, unit was clean and comfortable. Really enjoyed sunrise from the lanai. We hiked to Waimoku Falls at Kipahulu, swam at Hamoa Beach, checked out the brackish caves at Wainipapa State Park, visited Hasegawa General Store daily. Be aware: finding a place to eat in Hana is a challenge. Hotel Hana Maui is good but very pricey. Hana Ranch: owned by Hotel Hana Maui (like almost everything in town) food is OK but expensive and the flies were maddening! Plus they don't open for breakfast until 10am! Tutu's had delicious teriyaki chicken and was reasonably priced. Both stores have pretty slim pickins for cooking meals...best bet: bring something to BBQ. Hasegawa had pretty decent veggies. Hana Kai has BBQ grill and well equiped kitchens. This is a wonderful place to stay and we will go back!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Hana - just be sure that Hana is for you”
Reviews.Author: AndyTheGameInventor
Reviews.Content: We spent the first three nights of our honeymoon at Hana Kai in an oceanfront condo. Hana Kai has 2 buildings - the larger one in the back and the oceanfront one by the beach. (The larger one in the back also has perfect ocean views, but in the smaller one you seen nothing but beach ocean from your balcony.) The actual condo is very comfortable though not luxurious - envision your uncle's really nice 1-bedroom summer cottage. The condo has a full kitchen (except dishwasher) and really nice bed, a deck that overlooks the beach. The sound of the surf pounds on the rocks outside 24 hours a day, and I say that in a good way. The scenery is spectacular. There is no better place to unwind. One other reviewer mentioned that it is on a black sand beach. This is NOT accurate. It's on a black ROCK beach, not suitable for swimming. However there are swimmable beaches (including black sand) a few minutes away. This is the only thing I'll fault them for - not the rock beach but the fact that they use the word oceanfront without disclosing that the beach is actually rocks. The photo on their site is take from a black sand beach about 10 minutes walk away. (The hotel is the green-roofed buildings in the background) Service was very friendly and personal. Sitting on our deck eating dinner overlooking the ocean 100 feet away was the perfect start to our married life. We had a great time, and highly recommend this hotel. Is this hotel perfect? It depends, you have to like Hana. We spent 3 nights here and then 5 nights in a club-level suite at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. (Not trying to brag - we splurged for our honeymoon!). The point is that both hotels were OUTSTANDING but COMPLETELY DIFFERENT in every imaginable way. If you've been to Hana, you can skip the rest of this review. Hana is all about doing very little in stunningly beautiful surroundings. There are about 2 restaurants and 2 small stores. Like many visitors, we bought what we needed near the airport and cooked all our own meals. What little you can buy in Hana is generally very expensive, even compared to the main part of Maui. There are one or two activity providers, like a horseback riding company. If you're looking for snorkeling, parasailing, helicopter tours, luaus, souvenir shopping, gallery hopping, bar hopping, etc. those are easily available on West Maui, but not in Hana. Don't forget that the road to Hana takes about 2 hours each way and is a spectacular but tiring drive. By all means drive it during the day. Hana is like a step back in time - a more authentic Hawaii than you'll find in Lahaina - which means it's not for everybody - but it's one of the most beautiful places on earth.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hana!”
Reviews.Author: Sophie55197
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit #2, the oceanfront studio. It was immaculately clean and nicely decorated. The best part of our stay was spent lounging on the spacious lanai overlooking the bay. After several days of eating out, it was nice to cook for ourselves. The resort also offers laundry facitilies and great beach towels. Hana is such a lovely, peaceful place. We wish we had stayed longer. P.S. If you go to Hana, there's great Thai food at a little, open-air cafe across from the ballpark.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: grandmato2
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hana Kai Maui. Our lanai looked out over a black sand beach and we could hear the waves crashing onshore all night as we slept. The sunrise was fantastic. The gardens surrounding the area were lovely---lots of flowers, colorful plants and koi ponds.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, quiet place in a beautiful setting.”
Reviews.Author: jlh317
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hana Kai Maui for one night at the end of our vacation to Maui. We had a premium studio which had a queen size bed on the main level and a queen bed in a loft (with stairs.) It also included a small kitchen which was pretty much fully equipped (except it didn't have a dishwasher...not a big deal as we didn't make any extravagent meals.) The view from the lanai was gorgeous and we loved the nice beachy decor of the unit. Our children (11 and 8) loved sleeping in the loft and we all had a comfortable night sleep. A couple of things to note: The wifi didn't really work very well unless you were in one specific spot on the lanai right next to the rail. This wasn't a huge deal, but since they advertise wifi, it is worth noting. Also, this is a very quiet place with posted quiet hours (I think from 10pm-8am) Our kids are not very noisy, but I could see how it would be a bit trying for everyone if that wasn't the case. Staying here allowed us to take our time on the "road to Hana" and gave us a great head start to the Oheo Gulch pools in the morning before the crowds rolled in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms on a black sand beach”
Reviews.Author: skdumas
Reviews.Content: This place was just wonderful. We stayed there for only one night, but wished we had known how wonderful this little place was, because we would have stayed an extra day. Some of our friends stayed in another room, so we were able to see two of the rooms. Both rooms were individually decorated with cute beachy decor. The rooms were very clean and so cozy. The rooms had these great dark wood louver doors both as the entry door and as the sliding doors onto the balcony that let the cool ocean breeze flow through the room. The night we were there it rained, so our last night in Hana (and in Hawaii) was spent sleeping to the sound of crashing waves and rain. It was so nice. My only negative comment was that there isn't much to block the bright sun from coming into the rooms in the morning. It would be nice if they had some window coverings to block the sun in the morning. I highly recommend spending a night at the Hana Kai-Maui if you stay in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “The view was so romantic !”
Reviews.Author: k4d4
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 1 night after we've done the road to Hana. The place is so quite and so relaxing. We woke up with the sound of the waves......wow!

Reviews.Title: “My New "Happy Place"”
Reviews.Author: AnyplaceOnce
Reviews.Content: We stumbled into the Hana Kai without a reservation and took the last open room. The prices were a little high to me (esp since we already had a place paid for in Kaanapali) but forget about that!!! Do yourself a favor and stay here. Sooooo relaxing, laid back, perfect location, and a lanai to die for! Seriously I have never felt more relaxed than sitting on that lanai drinking wine and watching the waves roll onto Hana Bay. (I really did conjure this up when having my teeth drilled.)The front desk girl was very sweet also. Hasegawa's has food and drink handy. It made all the difference to overnight in Hana and have the extra time for Wainapanapa, Red Sand Beach, Hamoa Beach, and the Pipiwai/Oheo Gulch exploring. Loved!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely spectacular, gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Tailssouth
Reviews.Content: We picked the perfect place to get married! We stayed in the two bedroom condo on the top floor and had the most beautiful view of the harbor, black sand beach, and water fall-ponds from the lanai. It was so gorgeous we decided to get married right there on the lanai. I can't say enough about this condo. The tastful furniture, fabulous bed/bedding, patio off the bedrrom, lanai with beautiful talbe/chairs and loveseat. Stainless steel appliances, beautiful breakfast bar, living room with huge windows, great bathrooms, local girls that cleaned the whole condo spotless! The people who own it had a book on the desk where people who've stayed there have written a note about their stay. The manager Stanley was wonderful and we called to him from the lanai to come and celebrate with a glass of champagne after our ceremony. Well worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a baby”
Reviews.Author: shordan77
Reviews.Content: My husband, my infant of four months and I, stayed in room #2 (popolana). Our favourite part was how well we all slept here, the waves, the coy fish pond, and the breeze were like a symphony conducted by nature, it relaxed us and lulled us to sleep. I have to stress that it is an extremely relaxing location and we thouroughly enjoyed our stay here. My husband swam in the surf with the turtles as I beach combed with the baby and my coffee. We enjoyed exploring the town and its beaches, after just spending one day touring around the town we felt like locals. On the way out of Hana, we took our time and travelled along the southern side instead of the Hana highway, it was worth it as it was extremely scenic. All in all it was very relaxing especially after drinving the Hana highway which frankly made me a little ill. Our room was tastefully decorated with a traditional yet modern Hawaiin theme the colours were very soothing and the natural shampoo and soap were a very nice touch. The kitchen was well stocked and organized no need to bring extras as they had everything that you needed and more. There was also a herb garden available to use, so if you are cooking then you don't need to purchase and stock up on the pricey extras which I thought was also a nice touch. We assigned a score of 3 out of 5 in value because it was a little bit on the pricey side not to mention the town was expensive in both of the grocery stores and the restaurants. As a tourist you feel a little gouged so if you are planning a trip to Hana plan to spend a little extra, you will also want to buy banana bread and maybe some local art. I recommend to bring along a little cash on your way up so that you can stop at the fruit stands and sample some of the local fare. Just a little side note and not a big deal but we did have two cock roaches in our room, we informed the staff and they explained that they had just fumigated so they were bound to come out for a visit with the guests. I believed them as we were able to catch them and kill them so they must have been sluggish from the fumigation.

Reviews.Title: “Would return in a heartbeat - great value”
Reviews.Author: alongmontanawinter
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous place to stay after the long drive to Hana. The condo is RIGHT on the beach with views framed by palm trees. This was by far our CLEANEST accomodations on Maui. The staff service was impeccable. We stayed in unit #1 the first night. A large 1 bedroom with a full kitchen, spacious bathroom and excellent lanai looking right out onto the ocean. We thought the hotel should have "sold" this unit a little better. On line it looks like #2 is actually nicer. And while nice (we stayed in #2 the 2nd night), it was much smaller with a tiny kitchen and smaller bath. The lanai in #2 is also wonderful. I think we paid around $225 per night and found it a great value. Their "ocean view" condos aren't that much less expensive, so go for the beach front condos (1,2,or 3). For access to the beach, the beauty of the grounds, the service, and the cleanliness this was a great place to stay. A room of this quality on the west shore would be at least $100 more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Suites in Hana, right on beach.”
Reviews.Author: JTea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit (#4) for 2 nights in Feb. 2010. The unit is right on a black sand beach - a bit rocky for swimming but there were some boogie boarders out one day. Our unit wasn't super updated - my inlaws had unit 1 which was quite new. Both units have a large screened lanai, and both were very clean and nice. No restaurant at the hotel, and few in Hana. We mostly ate in the bar area of the Hana Hotel, which was casual and had good food (and live Hawaiian music in the evenings). Nice organic bathroom and kitchen supplies. The loud waves crashing kept me awake a bit at night, but given the limited lodging options in Hana, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Skiwahine
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect from a place that was individually owned but operated like a hotel. However, I was pleasantly surprised by the various units. There was diversity but consistency. All units had basic kitchen supplies and it almost felt like being at home. The refrigerator in our unit was very large and clean. Everything else was good to acceptable. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's not the destination.....it's how you get there”
Reviews.Author: Alberta_Lola
Reviews.Content: The best part of Hana is getting there. I would recommend renting a small, compact car to do the winding road. There are tour companies that do the drive for you, but they have larger "shuttle" buses (vans). Once in Hana, there are only two grocery stores. Not a lot of options for fresh food. If you are planning on staying in Hana for a few days, you should get your groceries from Costco or Walmart in Kahului (airport), then take them with you. There are also not a lot of options for eating out in Hana. Most places close early. Hana seems to be a "sleepy" little town. If you want to relax and get away from the bigger more touristy places like Lahaina, then Hana is for you! As for the Hana Kai Maui, we stayed one night in unit #107. It was great! We had a view of the ocean from our balcony. Full kitchenette, large bedroom & bathroom. Would recommend staying here! The place is close to the Red sand beach (Kaihalulu Beach). It's only about a ten minute walk to the start of the trail, leading you to the beach. The place is a bit pricey. We paid $236 for one night. Not sure if the value is better the longer you stay.... The only staff we dealt with was the one lady who checked us in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Hana”
Reviews.Author: onemoretime
Reviews.Content: Didnâ€™t really like the look of the only room available (1 BR #3) online but the view of the ocean hooked us in. We checked in early evening so we didnâ€™t catch the view until the next morning. What a lovely view of the sunrise. The room has a huge lanai, but it definitely needs some sort of privacy screen and maybe some nicer furniture. We spent many hours sitting on that lanai just looking out to the ocean, sipping cocktails. The grounds are gorgeous but the room itself needs some major updating. Itâ€™s clean, had great water pressure and has enough amenities, it just looks pretty dated. Comfortable bed and awesome pillows. Not sure if it was the pillow or the surf pounding outside my window but I sure slept well. Has a nice community grill that we used once. Any staff that we encountered was very pleasant. We thoroughly enjoyed our three night stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful little secret”
Reviews.Author: CamilleAnn
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Hana Kai! It was fully equipped with all kitchenware and a beautiful view of the black sand beach, which is literally outside your back door. We walked over to the Hana Hotel and were immediately digusted with the yuppie attitudes and unnaturalness of the whole place. They own nearly everything in Hana and act like it, too. So, it was nice to be with the locals in and around Hana Kai. Anyway, I would love to keep Hana Kai a secret, but they deserve recognition. This place made our decision to come back to Hana and stay another week. Thank you Hana Kai for such a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we'd been here the entire time”
Reviews.Author: rachelinsf
Reviews.Content: My mom and I traveled to Maui for the first time in late October. Stayed in Ka'anapali for most of the trip because we were attending a conference there. Decided, on a whim, to spend the last night in Hana because we didn't want to drive the Hana Hwy roundtrip in one day. Boy, was that the right thing to do! Gorgeous and exotic drive (be sure to stop at the Garden of Eden) and then landed in lovely, sleepy Hana, which was what we had imagined and wanted Maui to be. Loved it. And LOVED the Hana Kai. Very friendly staff, and wonderful amenities.
