I gather each condo is separately owned and therefore amenities may vary, but our one-bedroom (which was a complimentary upgrade from the studio we booked) was fantastic. I don't recall the Unit number, but it was on the corner of the upper building. Clean, spacious, brand new appliances, great water pressure, lovely lanai, incredible views...everything you'd want and more. We agreed we could easily return for a week or more and just hang out, relax, read, beachcomb -- in fact, we hope to. Will happily by-pass all of the rest of Maui and just spend time here on the next trip. If you're looking for nightlife and action, this is not your spot. But if you want seclusion, quiet, stunning sunrises, beaches that have more locals than tourists, and unparalleled natural beauty, Hana is your place and the Hana Kai is a fantastic option.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and relaxing stay at Hana Kai #206!”
Reviews.Author: CamarilloCat5
Reviews.Content: The condo (which is owned and rented separately from the front desk, by the owners) is in a great location in Hana with a beautiful view of Hana Bay. We fell asleep to the sound of the ocean each night. We BBQ'd every night using the "communal" BBQ, although we were the only ones we saw using it during our stay. We ate romantic candlelit dinners every night on the lanai. We were glad we decided to stay 3 nights in Hana so we could take our time getting there and spend two full days exploring. One day after hiking from the O'heo pools, through a bamboo forest to (gorgeous) Waimoku Falls we returned to the condo to drop off our car and walked all of the way to the amazing Red Sand Beach, swam and relaxed and walked back to the condo. We spent most of our second day body surfing at lovely Hamoa Beach. The condo is decorated in a beautiful, modern, tropical style....very soothing. We used the Ipod docking station/stereo system and it sounded great. Cooking spices, games, DVDs (and portable DVD player), CDs, books (including Maui guidebooks), beach chairs, umbrella, boogie boards, cooler, beach towels, tropical shampoo and soaps all provided by the thoughtful owners, Shayla and Mark. The only thing we didn't like is that we had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “A motel- not a resort”
Reviews.Author: person_from_earth
Reviews.Content: We got stuck staying at this over-priced shack on our beautiful trip to Hana. Our money would have been better spent staying at the Hana Resort, as this was not much less. But after a long drive we just wanted to take a warm shower and we discovered that the shower was dirty after we arrived and unpacked the bags. Luckily we only stayed the night. The only way to sleep was with the windows open, so at sun rise the sounds of several families did not allow us to sleep. The staff was rude too! And they charged us a RESORT fee! They don't even have a swimming pool.... there is NO RESORT. It is just a stinky, tiny shack.

Reviews.Title: “Still dreaming of the view long after the trip”
Reviews.Author: CCButtons
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed in Unit #2 and loved every minute of it. What makes this unit spectacular is definitely the ocean front view. This is as close to the ocean as you can get and because it is the closest to the water of all units you feel like it is just for you! Because the beach is rocky, not sandy, we hardly saw any people using it, so it definitely made our view very private! Waking up in the morning and having breakfast on the lanai was our favourite thing to do. This unit has all of the amenities that you would need. While the kitchen is on the small size, it doesnâ€™t need to be any bigger for the amount of people who stay in the room. There are two bar fridges with freezer compartments. There are more than enough dishes, cooking utensils, pots, pans, blender and coffee maker. Thereâ€™s even a herb garden outside which all guests are invited to snip off of herbs and cook with! There is no air conditioning, but with the breeze from the ocean and the slotted doors and windows at the other end of the unit, you really great a cross breeze and it is more than comfortable. At the check-in desk, everyone was really friendly and helpful. Towels are picked up here and we were even able to use boogie boards that some other guests had left. Housekeeping comes in to tidy up every morning and they even put away dishes that I had left in the drying rack. The grounds are well-maintained with flowers and ponds filled with koi. The only possible downside is that because all windows and doors are open and people sit on their balconies, you can hear your neighbours. You can hear sounds between both buildings, but being in the lower building closer to the water really helps to block out the sound. (I liked the lower building better as well because the balconies are more spread out while the upper building has balconies side by side). While the noise is a bit of a downside, it still is one of the most amazing places and the view and balcony more than make up for it. One day, I hope that I will be able to go back there!

Reviews.Title: “not the best deal”
Reviews.Author: DiMe2
Reviews.Content: Accommodation options in Hana are somewhat limited but this is not the best of the lot. The view is indeed fantastic, but it is at other places as well. If you are going to stay here, there are two important bits of information that you need: 1) Note that this is _not_ a resort in the literal sense, though it is presented as such. This matters purely because they charge an extra $20 "resort fee" (not advertised when you initially book the room, but added at the time of final bill) and you may well wonder what it is you are getting for that fee. I tend to think that if hotels need extra money that badly, they should just increase the cost of the room accordingly. 2) Next, check out time is 10:00 a.m., earlier than I have ever seen, anywhere. We had planned a full morning in Hana on the day of our departure, which we were not able to enjoy because we had to leave so early (you can't really enjoy a morning hike or beach walk with all of your cases in the trunk of your car, ripe for the picking). Oh, and p.s.: no air conditioning and no maid service (I guess unless specifically requested). Conclusion: not a good value. If you have only a short stay in Hana, look for a b&b in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit in #206”
Reviews.Author: Athenian2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 206 for 5 nights. I was worried before I came that I would run out of things to do in Hana for 4 days. But it was just perfect - very relaxing. We had to make our own beds, but I liked that feature because I didn't have to worry about housekeeping coming in and moving things around - and I was able to come and go without worrying about anyone else's schedule. I really appreciated the cooking facilities and the left over items from other guests - salt pepper, etc. We ate two nights at the Hotel Hana Maui - but I was glad to cook for myself the other 3 nights - because the Hotel Hana Maui only changes the menu once a month - and didn't seem to offer any nightly specials. We brought in food from the West side of Maui the first night - because there isn't much to choose from in the local stores. The Boogie boards available in the condo were wonderful. I had never tried one before and it was nice to get to try it out for free. The table for meals on the Lanai was also wonderful - we always had a pleasant breeze and a great view. I was very concerned about whether it would be cool enough upstairs for sleeping. But by running the ceiling fan below at full speed - ponited up - and running the oscillating fan in the loft we were able to sleep just fine. (Maui was having a heat wave during our visit - but I suspect that the temperatures were only slightly higher than norma. We loved our visit and would gladly return and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hideaway in tropical paradise with comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: jwestArizona
Reviews.Content: Hana Kai 206 is loaded with artistic touches that bring the tropical beauty of Hana inside. We were greeted by a gorgeous flower arrangement on the kitchen counter containing perfect specimens of every gorgeous flower we had photographed on the road trip up. Showering after the long drive was very refreshing. The luxurious bath features a unique adjustable double shower head and luscious coconut soap. A lava rock sink and beautiful rock tiles with turtle impressions really added a touch of elegance. All the spices and little extras we needed to prepare our favorite dinner were found in the cabinets and even ice packs in the refrigerator - so running out the Hasawaga Store wasn't really necessary. But the store is only just moments away, with lots of history and interesting local information so we visited it anyway. The owners of 206 have provided everything you can think of to enjoy yourself while playing and relaxing here and on the nearby beaches. Their recommendations of things to do was very helpful and right on. We photographed fantastic waterfalls just a shortdrive away, captured magnificent sunrises from nearby Koki Beach and off the 206 lanai, plus caught some great waves with the boogie boards provided by the owners. The loft with bamboo A frame ceiling and king sized adjustable bed is beyond comfortable - often its a challenge to not nap your whole afternoon away. The black rock beach at the foot of the complex is loaded with washed up surprises from the sea each morning. Oh and did I mention how good the coffee tastes sipping it on the lanai at sunrise ? This is by far one of the coziest most beautiful places I have vacationed. Its like you are hidden away in a tropical paradise with all the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: rkff
Reviews.Content: I had to write and simply say how helpful the staff is as this resort. I was staying at a house in Hana, and got lost twice. Even though I was not their guest, when I asked for help, Miya went the extra mile on two different occasions to make sure I found my destination. Thanks Miya! Robert Fisher Salt Lake City, UT

Reviews.Title: “remarkable get away”
Reviews.Author: sheilaandchuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hana Kai 206 a few weeks ago, and it has taken this long to get back to the real world. We stayed in Hana for our 30th anniversary, it was our last stop on the islands, we couldn't have picked a better spot to stay. The condo is all it's cracked up to be and more. Hana was just what we had hoped it would be. We loved the blender for pina colodas every night on the lanai. We spent most of our evenings out there enjoying the sights and sounds of the ocean, a great way to unwind after days of hiking and sight seeing. Thank you so much for the hospitality. Shayla, I was able to find that great soap, and it will always bring us back to our great hana vacation. Chuck and Sheila Noel

Reviews.Title: “overpriced”
Reviews.Author: lisaandbart
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights - accomodations were expensive for what you get - it's aged, a bit dirty, and BED BUGS. View was nice. Staff was not accomodating about changing length of stay. I wouldn't stay there again. This was a "motel style" accomodation at "Ritz Carlton" prices. You can really hear the noise from other residents in other units - poor construction without any soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay in Unit #101”
Reviews.Author: LMK5
Reviews.Content: Hana Kai Maui is a small complex on a residential street in Hana. There is no pool or restaurant on the grounds, so I wouldn't go so far as to call it a "resort." It does however sit right on Hana Bay, with wonderful views from the unit and grounds. The property also has a lawn area with chairs on the ocean side, a barbecue area with tables, koi ponds, and a path for access to the beautiful black rock beach fronting the complex. There are beach towels available to guests at the front desk. There is a parking area but be careful if you have a van or full size vehicle as the maneuvering is tricky. The grounds are well tended, and the lady at the front office was very helpful, even searching other units to find us a larger pot in which to boil water for our pasta. We stayed for 2 nights to give ourselves plenty of time to explore the area. Unit #101 has one bedroom with a queen bed, one smallish bathroom, and 2 daybeds in the living area. The front office provided a floor mattress for our third child. This provided ample sleeping room for all 5 of us. The lighted lanai was very large with a great view; the kitchen was adequate; and the bathroom had a shower and single sink but did not have an outlet for a shaver or hair dryer. There also was a small porch right off the bedroom, but it faces the parking lot. There is no TV or phone in the unit, but hey, you go to Hana to get away from the excessive stimulation of the "real" world, right? Don't expect the energy of Kaanapali or Lahaina here. Hana is slooow, soothing, and beautiful...real Hawaii. I laugh at reviews where people are surprised and disappointed at the slow pace of Hana. The slightest amount of research will tell you that this is not the place for shopaholics and bar hoppers. It's a place to ease our Type A tendencies by soaking in a different vibe. We were happy with our stay at Hana Kai Maui. It does seem a little expensive for what you're getting compared to West Maui, but everything is very expensive in this remote area. This particular unit was a little darker than we would have liked, but we were out during the daylight hours anyway. The furnishings were adequate, the staff friendly, and the airflow through the unit was excellent. And because you have a kitchen, you can go to Hasegawa's General Store or the Hana Ranch Grocery and get yourself something to prepare in your unit. This will save you a bundle on the few and overpriced eateries in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time”
Reviews.Author: SuziCLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We were in Hana over 30 years ago and stayed at the same resort. Not much has changed in Hana or the Hana Kai but unit 206 has been completely updated. Hana is a lush quiet spot with not much going on except for the beauty of the beaches, waterfalls and green green drives and hikes. We were there for 3 days and we wish we had more time. The unit had chilled beer mugs, an espresso maker, a great bed and a very romantic lanai. There were beach toys and coolers and an ipod dock along with a collection of DVDs. We were a little nervous about the road but it's not bad if you go slow. The owners did the condo in the same style as their unit at Maui Kai. Bamboo ceilings and cheerful furniture. The stairs to the loft are a little steep so you have to be careful. We left a night light on for safety.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Hana Kai 206”
Reviews.Author: heart3
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at Hana Kai in Dec. 2008. We loved the ease of making reservation online and finding everything as promised. Shayla is a great host. Condo had wonderful furnishings and we apprecaited the staple items such as spices, etc. in the kitchen. Kitchen was wonderful. Loved sleep number bed!! Loved the view and sounds of the ocean and rain from the condo. It is impressive to hear the rocks rolling on the beach. Only down side: we are from a cool climate and had a hard time adjusting to heat and humidity even though Dec. is the winter. Condo has no air conditioning although it is well ventilated with wind blowing, if it is still, it is warm. View from balcony is gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Unit 206/Hana Kai Resort”
Reviews.Author: happytravels1212
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for a couple. The unit is impeccable, has a great location and we would go back immediately. You can see that the owners put a lot of thought into taking care of every possible need in this quite remote and beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MoofBurbank
Reviews.Content: Great view from waterfront rooms and balconies. Connecting rooms worked well. No need for air conditioning and the beds were very comfortable. Well managed and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, relaxing place, cheap by Hana standards”
Reviews.Author: p27159
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that if you took this exact property, picked it up, and moved it to just about any other location in the world, I'd give it a lower rating. But it's right on the ocean in Hana! The rooms were OK -- comfortable, clean, spacious, but a little worn and dated. But to be able to open the sliding door and hear the ocean in your room at night -- that was one of the most unforgettable experiences we've ever had. The place has a full kitchen too, which comes in handy because the food in this area is really expensive and there aren't a lot of restaurants around. Some people complained that there wasn't much to do in Hana, but that's not the point in coming to a place like this! If you're looking for a laid back, relaxing time with incredible scenic views and sounds, and don't want to spend a ton of money at a place like the Hana Maui, then this is the place for you. We've been to this place twice so far, allowing us to relax after making the drive on the "Road to Hana" so we didn't have to drive up and back the same day, and wouldn't hesitiate to stay here on our next trip to Maui. We found that if we can get a flight that gets in early enough in the afternoon, we can take the drive to Hana that first day, spend a night or two in Hana, then head back to Kaanapali/Lahaina and stay the rest of the time there. Or we just spend the first night near the airport and do the drive to Hana the next day. This way we get consecutive night stays in Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Hana and our relaxing stay at this small resort exemplifies Hawaii's aloha spirit.”
Reviews.Author: Chas87112
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our 4 night stay here. My wife was concerned at first as there are no TVs or radios but quickly got over it as we could hear the gentle surf from anywhere in our suite (we were upstairs, unit 204, with ocean view). Our second floor one bedroom unit was very clean and fabulously furnished. The most comfortable bed out of four places we stayed during our 10th anniversary Hawaiian vacation. We'll stay longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai #5 is GORGEOUS!”
Reviews.Author: Southerngirl528
Reviews.Content: Okay, I hesitated to write this review because I don't want to have problems booking this unit when we return, but the owners have just completely renovated this 2 bedroom oceanfront condo and it is drop dead gorgeous! #5 is the ONLY 2 bedroom condo at Hana Kai. I did not see any other units, but it appeared they all have terrific ocean views. The pictures shown on Unit #5 are EXACTLY what you get... luxurious comfort, and views to make you weep! We stayed 2 nights, at the very beginning of our 12 night Maui vacation, but will most likely stay longer next time because Hana was exactly "what the doctor ordered"! We could actually FEEL the stress leaving. # 5 has a huge COVERED lanai, where we played cards when it rained, and enjoyed all our meals. Staying in Hana more than 1 night is not for everyone, but if, like me, you've dreamed of paradise, without all the touristy trappings, and you can be still and enjoy the breathtaking sunrises, and lush scenery, and the company of your family/friends, then this is certainly the place for you!!! To the owners of #5, thank you for sharing your gorgeous Hana condo. It was TRULY spectacular, and a blessing to me, my husband, daughter and son-in-law. We WILL be back! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travelseaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 202. The view was fantastic. The Lanai was excellent with really nice table and a comfy reclining chair. The room was recently remodeled and it looked fabulous. The bed was extremely comfortable, so much that we pulled the sheets to check out the brand. The location was good for Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Jean6
Reviews.Content: Unless you are traveling in Hawaii for a week or more it is not worth the money to stay here. The rooms are clean but the beach is horrible. It is made of big rocks and hard to walk on and you can't swim at the hotel beach (very dangerous). It was not worth the money spent- I would rather had made the drive which was worth it and stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: KeeKeex2
Reviews.Content: First, I would like to make it clear that we (my boyfriend and I) did not end up staying at this "resort." However, I did think it was important to share our experience. This was the part of our week long trip to Maui that I had been looking forward to. I couldn't wait to get away from it all and enjoy laying out on the beach in front of the resort. The Hana highway was quite an experience to drive, but we had done worse on the other side of the island. When we arrived at the Hana Kai, I couldn't wait to check in. We parked, and I immediately noticed the beach and that there wasn't one. From the company's website, the "beach" in front of these accommodations looked to be black sand. I was very surprised when we arrived to find that what appeared to be a black sand beach was nothing but black stones all over the place. This was not what I had in mind when I pictured myself laying out and watching the waves. In any case, we proceeded to the check-in office. We had originally booked unit #204 which was decorated and had a view that I particularly liked. When we checked in, we were not able to get unit #204 because the stove was broken. We were immediately "upgraded" to unit #201. We paid and went to our room. The first thing I noticed was the age of the accommodations and the stuffiness of the room. I knew there was no air conditioning, but no window or door had been opened in preparation for our arrival. The unit was extremely small, but did have a large lanai. It was clean, but it clearly showed its age. The units do not have tv and are only equipped with one ceiling fan. This "upgrade" we had received did not seem like one at all. Immediately we did not get a relaxing vibe from this place. We didn't feel comfortable and really could not put our finger on why. As such, I decided to approach the management desk where we had checked in. I explained to the ladies that the "resort" was just not what we had anticipated. The ladies were extremely nice and understanding. They explained that if we would decide before closing time if we wanted to leave, they would refund our money (minus the deposit). I was very surprised by this as I knew that they would be losing a lot of money on a confirmed reservation that was backing out at the last minute. Again, they were so generous and understanding to the fact that this place just wasn't what we had thought it was. To be honest, there was no decision to make. Once they said we would get the remainder of our money back, we checked out. We hadn't even unloaded our rental car yet. They did keep our deposit which we thought was completely fair, but these ladies were truly nice about the whole situation. Many people/companies wouldn't be that understanding. In any case, I would recommend this hotel to other people. It just simply wasn't what we were looking for. We finally figured out that not only was the "resort" not what we were expecting, but it was the fact that this place just didn't even begin to compare to the amazing accommodations we received in Kihei (at the Aikane). If you are thinking of staying in Hana, make sure it is for you. There are limited places to eat, only one grocery store with an unfriendly clerk (unless you are Hawaiian), and really nothing to do. The ladies at the management of this resort said, "Hana is the vacation away from the vacation." If you find that laying on a rock beach, hiking, staring out in the dark at night, and cooking your own meals relaxing, then I would advise you stay in Hana and that you stay at the Hana Kai. However, we do not enjoy having nothing to do in the evening, and I do not find cooking and cleaning on my vacation relaxing. Simply, this just wasn't what we wanted, but to each his own.

Reviews.Title: “My new "Happy Place"”
Reviews.Author: got-2-get-away-now
Reviews.Content: Do you have a happy place? You know, the place you close your eyes and drift off to when everything around you is going crazy? Well, I found my new happy place - it's unit #5 of the Hana Kai. The location, decor, ocean views, ocean breeze, and black sand beach - everything about our stay here was perfect. Waking up and watching he sunrise from your bed while breathing in a gentle ocean breeze .... I've never experienced anything like it. The only thing I regret is not staying longer. My family and I had an absolute perfect experience staying with Susie Pu and the rest of the staff. Every moment, from check in to check out, we were treated with a sense of caring and warmth. The town of Hana is an absolute must see when visiting Maui, and I strongly recommend staying at least two nights at the Hana Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Heaven”
Reviews.Author: BobF044
Reviews.Content: The Hana Kai Maui Resort is a marvelous facility. The location on the beach could not be more ideal. The sun rise and ocean views are spell binding. The site is quiet, well-maintained and comfortable. The staff are very plesant and helpful. I will return. The website photos are accurate representations of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “The Hana Kai was great for the first 4 days of honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: daut_travler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Unit 2 at Hana Kai April 20-24th and had a fabulous experience at this wonderful little place with amazing views of the black sand beach and some time to just relax at an amazing location. It rained every day we were thereâ€¦ but drove to do some hikes and find some sun every day. When you sleep in these rooms at night you are overwhelmed by the sounds of the ocean and the ambiance is unlike any you can find in Hawaii (and I have been to Hawaii 8+ times). But donâ€™t expect the amenities of the Grand Waliea - - but do expect an equally relaxing stay if you like the outdoors and donâ€™t mind cooking for yourself. I was a little concerned because it sounds like some of these reviews on this place are from overzealous condo owners that are simply trying to get people to book their condosâ€¦ but let me tell you if you stay in the lower building you cannot but disappointed. I hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: George03
Reviews.Content: Hana Kai is clean and the location is nice IF you have one of the units with a view of the water. We stayed in unit #102 which provided a nice view. We felt that #102 was a pretty spartan affair for which we paid $222 per night plus a onetime service fee of $20. There really wasn't any service. There is also no A/C, no heat, and no TV. Our room did include a kitchenette and there was a very nice propane grill available on the grounds. The trouble is that the options in Hana are really limited unless you split for the Resort so it may be necessary to stay at Hana Kai and just accept that value is not an option in this town. We ate at the Hana Maui Resort which was OK but also overpriced. We had read so-so reports about the Hana Ranch restaurant but decided to try it anyway. On a positive note, although the menu is limited in scope, we felt that the choices available were very good, as was the service and that the price was fair. Don't let this review discourage you from driving out to Hana. In a four week trip through the islands the road to Hana (and slightly beyond) was one of the most memorable things that we did. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Unit 206 is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DebMGlenview
Reviews.Content: Unit 206 is beautiful. Shayla, the owner, has remodeled the condo with really cool details. She turned a studio condo into a 1 bedroom by building a loft bedroom which has plenty of headroom because the condo ceiling is about 20 feet high. The bedroom walls and ceiling are covered in bamboo matting and the bedspread has tropical flowers so you really feel like you're in paradise. The bed also has dual controls for mattress firmness. The bathroom has really pretty tile and fixtures and the bathroom sink is a big lava rock with a bowl carved in it. Super cool. All the kitchen appliances are high-end too and everything is labeled so you can find things or know how to operate something. The balcony is wonderful for dining and has a beautiful view of the beach which is just steps away. Shayla's even provided DVD's, books, CD's, games, etc. All sorts of things to make your stay comfortable. There's even lots of spices, etc. in the cupboards for your use. Shayla is really fantastic and provides a lot of information about the condo and facilities but also what to do in Hana and the surrounding area, her personal recommendations for dining (indoors and road-side) and what beaches are best for different activities. We would definitely stay here again next time we're in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai #206”
Reviews.Author: DDFloyd
Reviews.Content: STAY HERE! I am one of those travellers that seek high and low to find the best places to stay when on vacation. My family (husband, daughter, and I) love the beach, and this condo definitely has a wonderful view of the beach. We enjoyed walking on the beach in the morning and coming home to relax there later in the day. We ate breakfast outside on the covered patio while looking for whales-we saw several "blowing" in the morning and evening hours. Everything is exactly as described. Many extras in condo that we forgot at home-umbrellas, ice chests, extra beach towels. These were all greatly appreciated. Hana is truly a unique experience, and this particular condo was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “cheapest room - best stay”
Reviews.Author: mollypants
Reviews.Content: When you finally get to Hana, you realize how small of a community it is. It also means there aren't a lot of hotels to choose from, and while it was a little more than I wanted to spend, after four or so hours of driving, hiking and exploring, knowing that I had a clean room waiting for me at the end of the day was priceless! I stayed in the studio, non-ocean view, and I still could see the ocean. There is everything you need in the kitchen, and I went to the general store and bought some items to make dinner. They even supply foil and salt and pepper. And the herb garden outside unit 101 was great. They have all organic shampoos, etc. I wish I could have stayed another day. Or month.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Bamboo_Screen
Reviews.Content: #102 is nice, clean with a full kitchen and nice view, staff is friendly. Your dirty dishes get cleaned while you're out- might want to show your appreciation in the tip envelope when you leave. I didn't notice any room to room noise but if your neighbors are out on their deck you'll hear them. The decks are walled off and private. Easy walk to Hana, located on the beach. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “#206 - Perfectly a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ATLbeachmom
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Hana at Hana Kai #206 was fabulous. Shayla was easy to work with and things could not have gone more smoothly. The condo was beautiful and literally had everything! We shopped before the drive, but had forgotten coffee and sugar, both of which a previous traveler had conveniently left for those who followed. Our 4 year old slept very comfortably on the futon. The Sleep Number king bed in the loft bedroom was extremely comfortable too, though I will agree with a previous reviewer, that getting up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom is an adventure!! The location is great for exploring Hana and relaxing after a day of hiking. Hamoa Beach about 5 minutes from the condo is amazing, salt and pepper sand and perfect waves for bogie boarding. The first week of our visit we stayed at the Ritz in West Maui for my husband's business function. We explored all of that area, as well as Lahina and South Maui. Hana and #206 were a welcome relief from the commercialism & congestion of the rest of the island as well as the housekeepers! :) Wish we could have stayed longer....

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai 206 - A Hidden Gem on Maui's Hana Coast”
Reviews.Author: thisreview4u
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this beautiful condo in lovely Hana was the perfect ending to our 2-week vacation on the islands. The condo is privately owned by Mark and Shayla, who recently renovated it with impeccable detail and such beautiful aloha style. We had all the comfortable amenities we could have asked for, and many extras to make the stay in Hana even more memorable. Hana Kai 206 is a very special place that will make your stay in Hana unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: kaji_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 206 and must say that EVERYTHING about our stay exceeded our expectations. The unit was immaculate; well furnished; extremely well supplied with the "little things". If we ever return to Maui, we will definitely visit Hana again and we hope that Hana Kai 206 is available in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hana Kai #206”
Reviews.Author: JanieBIllinois
Reviews.Content: Renting this unit was a breeze from start to finish. A couple of emails back and forth with Shayla, the owner, and we were all set. There was no need to check in at the office as this is an independently owned condo. We used the code for the key box and we were in. This condo featured amenities not often found in a rental unit...granite countertops, ceramic floors, any modern appliance you could ever want. Never have I stayed in a condo that furnished so many "staples" such as flour, oil, sugar, foil, garbage bags, etc. There was even a cupboard with "food to share" that had microwave popcorn, pastas, canned soups and lots of seasonings. For those like me who need to go to sleep with the TV on, the portable DVD player and film library were much appreciated. Unfortunately, our 2 night stay in Hana was hampered by rain and clouds the entire time so I don't think we saw the true beauty of the place. But, I would not hesitate to recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Unit 206”
Reviews.Author: stones63
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay at your place..wish we could have stayed longer! We lacked for absolutely nothing and the floral arrangement was an especially nice touch. It was our first visit to Hana, although we have been to Maui multiple times. Hope to come back again and stay at your slice of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai 206 - Lovely place!”
Reviews.Author: HeJa
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve definitely enjoyed every moment of our stay at the unit 206. The unit was just as I expected (nice interior and lovely view from the balcony) but my wife liked it even better - she was amazed by the bathroom, the pictures and every single detail. It was one of our most comfortable stay not only in Hawaii but also during our long trip from Hungary. We would love to stay at here again.

Reviews.Title: “As Promised -- a little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Austen_gal
Reviews.Content: Some people have been writing reviews for the Hana Kai Condo complex, but this is specifically for Unit #206. This unit is owned independently from the rest of the condos. As such, it appeared to be in much nicer condition from the other condos we peeked into as we checked out. It's been fully remodeled and updated to be a luxurious getaway place. A lot of nice finishing touches were put in to give it a "boutique hotel room" sort of feel from the "rock" sink in the bathroom to the amazing shower head in the shower, with the amazing coconut soap/shampoo. This is the only unit with a dishwasher in it. The owners also had beachtowels, coolers, lawn chairs and snorkel gear for us to use during our stay. The even provided a popcorn maker, portable DVD player with a selection of DVDs, an espresso maker, a small library of reading material, and an iPod docking station with speakers. The lanai was beautiful laid out and a perfect place to enjoy your meals, or just relax in the papasan chair and take in the gorgeous view of the ocean. We fell asleep every night and awoke to the sound of the waves crashing on the shoreline. Super relaxing! The tips about Hana were invaluable! We tried out much of the advice and our favorite was the tip about eating at the local roadside food takeouts. Braddah Hutt's was amazing...and just about the best meal we had on Maui! BBQ chicken, steak and ribs to die for. The chef was even asked to cook for Hillary Clinton when she visited...and now we know why! Yum! If you can stay in Hana for a couple of nights, I would recommend it. It's so much more than a day trip out there and back. Hana itself doesn't offer a lot to do/see necessarily but there is much to do around there...including the Hanakalaka State Park (Pools of Oheo, etc) and heavenly beaches and waterfalls. We stopped as much on the way back, as we did on the way out. Less stressful that way. I would recommend buying groceries before you leave for Hana...it will save you some $$ that way. The two stores in Hana offer a lot, but prices are definitely higher. The only cons I have are that the lanai doors are hard to open/shut and that we had really noisy neighbors one night which marred our stay a bit. But beyond that, it was paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great view”
Reviews.Author: KranJams
Reviews.Content: This was our first overnight trip to Hana, so not a lot to compare. Our feeling is Hana Kai Maui offers solid value (for Maui, that is). The room was clean and tasteful (Unit #201). Comfortable beds. Small bathroom but the organic shampoo/conditioner/soap was a nice touch. The large lanai provided an excellent view of Hana Bay. The kitchen efficient and well stocked. All in all a good base for exploring Hana and Southeast Maui. PS - the only loud sounds we heard were the waves crashing onto the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Unit 206 - Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Widby2008
Reviews.Content: This review is for Unit 206, which is owned independently from other condos at the Hana Kai Resort. The condo was clean and nicely decorated and extremely well outfitted with upscale furniture and appliances. The unit was well stocked. To some extent we had seen that before at other vacation rentals, but never before to the level of detail at Hana Kai 206. There was body wash, shampoo and body lotion in the bath room, salad dressing, condiments and coffee in the fridge, and frosty mugs in the freezer waiting for a refreshing beer to be poured into them. The resort itself is located in a beautiful bay overlooking the water. We never had any problems with noise or smoke as mentioned in a previous review, but as in the case in many condos in Hawaii, the windows only have shutters (no glass) so they would not close completely and the units are relatively close to each other, so this could be an issue if you had bad neighbors. If you are looking for a place to stay in Hana - this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai 206”
Reviews.Author: Lucy7mo
Reviews.Content: Hana Kai 206 is a lovely, cozy condo on the Hana Bay. It was absolutely perfect! Exactly what we were looking for. It was a nice quiet, relaxing change from the hustle and bustle of the resort side of the island. The condo was in wonderful condition, clean, cute, absolutely terrific. I would recommend taking the road to Hana (a must do) and finish end at the condo. It's also very close to the rest of the Hana drive to the 7 Sacred Pools (another must-do). We especially had a nice evening cooking dinner, drinking wine and playing board games (that are available at the condo). It was the relaxing "get away" I hoped for. I would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to Maui and would also stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing Hana Kai 206 in remote, tropical Hana, Maui Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: theMewers
Reviews.Content: We wanted to take the fabled "Road to Hana", but did not want to make the 3 hour drive twice in one day. We found the "Hana Kai 206" through the owner website "http://hanakai206.com". Mark and Shayla of the Hana Kai 206 sent us lots of tips on Hana, including what to bring, local attractions and more. The Hana kai is a tidy condo with a world class view of a black sands beach where we watched the sun rise. The condo has a very efficient kitchen well equiped for meals, which suited us as we had tired of the (expensive) eating out. We highly recommend the Hana Kai 206 to anyone who wants to see this lovely part of Maui. Our only regret was that we had but 2 nights there.

Reviews.Title: “OK Place”
Reviews.Author: Cuteluke
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and our visit was ok. Since there is no air conditioning, everyone leaves their windows open so sound really travels from unit to unit. There are some sounds we would rather not hear..... There are house rules, but they do not seem to be enforced. Smoking is NOT prohibited on the lanais. However, we found that the majority of our neighbors ignored the house rules and smoked regardless. Quiet hours are from 8 am until 10 pm (I think), but again, our neighbors did not think this applied to them. We had no choice but to wake up at 6:30 am when the other folks did. Boisterous children made sure of that. The place has a nice view and BBQ area. It's an easy walk to the Hana Hotel which has good entertainment. The Thai roadside stand near the Hana Hotel has fabulous food. You can't go wrong. The roadside stand, owned by the local world class chef was a real disappointment. The food was not edible and we ended up tossing it out. It's on the south end of Hana. The pool was under construction, so there was quite a bit of noise from that in addition to all the other renos. We had gone in hope of a quiet, peaceful getaway, but that didn't quite happen for us. Before booking, check to see what construction activities are occuring and whether or not the non smoking policy applies, if that's important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Get your kicks... in Room 206 !”
Reviews.Author: YUtrippin
Reviews.Content: When youâ€™ve driven the road to Hana, you know youâ€™ve driven somewhere. Iâ€™m not talkinâ€™ ridinâ€™ in a tour bus, I mean wrangling the wheel yourselfâ€¦ through literally hundreds of hair pin turns, while waiting your turn to cross a dozen hair raising bridges narrow enough for only one car, one way. I didnâ€™t know that Iâ€™d need a place to rest when I got to the Hana end. But a wise friend of mine did, and she contacted Shayla Middleton, the private owner of the separately rentable Room 206 at the Hana Kai Resort, and made the arrangements for me. Now that Iâ€™ve stayed there, Iâ€™m ready to make that drive again! Forget the Seven Pools, simply luxuriating in this condo is worth the repeat trip. The delights are in the details, and Room 206 is rich with attention to design and detail. This isn't a cookie cutter condo... this place is tastefully hand done with a distinct styling that exudes class and is marvelous to look at and touch. Like the carved natural stone sink in the bathroom... you just want to hug it, as if it was an artifact unearthed from ancient Polynesia. To the left of this sink is a small pile of stones interleaved with face towels. So natural. Huge textured travertine tiles coat the bathroom floor and walls, trimmed with a band of random natural rocks that wraps around the shower, all lit by amazing looking light fixtures. The river of travertine tiles also flows from the entry into the well-appointed kitchen, that sports every appliance convenience you can think of... from built in automatic dishwasher (in the binder of instructions the owner states that Room 206 is the only condo at the Hana Kai that even has a dishwasher) to espresso maker to toaster oven (mounted on a stone/bamboo countertop extension) to smoothie blender to oven/range/microwave to cooking gadgets only seen on late night TV. If it is made for a kitchen, you will likely find it in one of the cabinets... where every shelf and drawer is fully labeled as to what goes where. On the subject of gadgets and conveniences, I noticed that there was high speed internet access, cat 5 cabling, cordless telephone, digital answering machine, digital music system, DVD player, along with a library of recent DVD movies. I didn't use any of that stuff... as I was escaping electronic social tethers, but for those that need a fix, this place has got the hook up. The high tech gee-wizardry continues up the rope-tied, bamboo railed and treaded stairway.. into the bamboo floored and wainscoted bedroom loft... hidden beneath the soft fluffy linens that are tucked between big tubes of bamboo headboard... in the form of a Select Comfort Sleep Number electronically adjustable bed. This bed has two remote controls that finely adjust the firmness/softness of each side of the bed... independently. Instead of hard metal coils for mattress springs, this bed uses individually segregated air chambers designed to relieve back pain while sleeping. Oh, and did I mention bamboo? The outdoor natural environs of a tropical Hawaiian paradise permeates seamlessly inside of this condo. Real bamboo is everywhere... on the door and window trim, across the vaulted cathedral high ceiling, and even in the artistic and unique furniture pieces that conceal other recurring condo themes of Hawaiian nature as well, like turtles. There is a natural essence to this placeâ€¦ a feeling harkening back to a Polynesian thatched hutâ€¦ only spotless clean, with all the modern conveniences. The tropical outdoors is also brought indoors magnificently in the original artwork hanging on the walls. Throughout the condo there are beautiful canvases of Maui waterfalls, geckos, flora, beachesâ€¦ but the piece dâ€™resistance has to be the humongous (who knows how many feet wide?) canvas of a Hawaiian beach scene that spans the entire living room lengthwise. Find your way out of this huge canvas, and the eye is greeted to the real thingâ€¦ the sound of waves and the sights of the black sand beach being lasciviously licked by the oceanâ€¦ all seen from the comfort of big basket chairs perched on the lanai (the outdoor balcony porch). The lanai of Room 206 is situated on the second floor of the Hana Kai complex. Being on the second floor not only affords the advantage of higher, airy ceilings inside the condoâ€¦ it offers much better views outside. I can only assume that the folks who get stuck in first floor condos might try to escape from their lower indoor ceilings by taking refuge out on their lanais, only to be stuck again staring at the wall of the building in front of them. Room 206 can see over the top of that other building, and thus one can directly see the sunrise kiss the sky from behind the horizon without ever leaving the room. Since Room 206 at the Hana Kai is rented privately, separate from the front desk program, there is an additional layer of personal protection and privacy that I like. You can come and go like you owned the place, and no one there is the wiser. No 9 AM harassment from housekeeping. No itinerant front desk staff perusing the personal information in your check-in records. No guest services calls bugging you to see if "everything is ok." Of course everything is OK. Being ensconced in a beautiful bamboo basket of a condo overlooking the black sand beach of Hana Maui... how could it NOT be OK? With no such threat of visitors, Room 206 is the perfectly private place to enjoy a prolonged, intimate, and varietal course of honeymooner's salad... lettuce alone, without the dressing! After surviving the road to Hana, get your kicks in Room 206.

Reviews.Title: “Good, could be better”
Reviews.Author: dhanson358
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Unit #2 for three nights in Hana. The location is great, and Unit 2 especially has a fantastic lanai looking right onto Hana Bay. The staff was very nice, but we had a few minor complaints. They were doing some kind of construction, both to a decorative pond area outside the buildilng, and to the unit above ours. They only seemed to work between about 10am and 4pm, but when they did, it was VERY loud. We mostly went out during the day (to Homoa beach, or to Haleakala Natl Park, etc), so it was just a minor annoyance, but if we had planned on spending the days in the room, it would have been a bad situation. The bed (Murphy Bed) was also not super comforable, but it was managable. Otherwise, everything was great. The price was good, and going to sleep with the sound of waves out the door is the ultimate in relaxation. Just from driving around, this seems to be one of the nicer properties in Hana. Overall, great place to stay. If you plan on spending most of the trip in your room (why?), make sure you ask about construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a night”
Reviews.Author: jenikate
Reviews.Content: Sorry this review is so late. My husband and I went to Maui on our honeymoon in October 07. We decided to make in impromtu trip to Hana and hadn't made any advance arrangements. The morning we were leaving we called the Hana Kai and luckily they had a vacancy. We arrived around 3pm after a leisurely drive up the road to Hana. After we checked in we went to the local grocery store and bought some stuff for dinner. It was very pricey, but way cheaper than the restaurant at the big hotel in Hana. Our room had a great balcony with an ocean view. We ate our dinner during sunset on the balcony. The kitchen had everything we needed to make dinner. The room was great and very nicely decorated. The hotel was in a great location. Overall I thought it was a great stay and we were lucky to get a room at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “One step of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BoyertownMusik
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just returned from celebrating our 25th anniversery in Hawaii this past June/July. We had booked unit #4 (Nanualele) the lower building corner, for our 2 night stay in Hana. Upon arriving in Hana, after stopping at a small outside Farmer's Market outside of town to pick up homemade pesto (Yum), we came upon the blue sign of "Hana Kai". Parking is at a minimum at the lower units, but never had a problem. Check in was a breeze. To our surprise the unit was even better than expected! Huge lanai overlooking the black sand beach & ocean, 2 day bedsin living rm, full kitchen, bed & bath. They have a nice grill on the bottom floor. We bought steaks at the general store and had grilled steak , baked potatos, corn & salad, on the lanai. The "Hana Kai" makes for a GREAT place to stay for a trip to the "Sacred Pools". If returning to Maui & Hana, would definetly book another stay at "Hana Kai! (Just be forwarned... when staying in the lower units, & having the windows open for night breeze, you WILL hear the fist size rocks washing back & forth on the beach!)

Reviews.Title: “peaceful hana”
Reviews.Author: anony
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio room (#102) for 2 nights. We found the room to be clean and nicely decorated. It had a full kitchen, and included kitchen supplies--- dinnerware, silverware, pots, cooking utensils--- I think anything you would need to prepare a simple meal. The refrigerator even had a filtered water pitcher filled with water already. When we arrived in the afternoon, since there is no a/c, the room felt stuffy, but by evening, with the breeze off Hana Bay, it was comfortable to sleep with the lanai doors open and ceiling fan on. The room has a lovely view of Hana Bay, and falling asleep to the sound of the water is so relaxing. The lanais have privacy walls, but sitting out at night, you do hear the conversations from others--- but we did not have any noise in our room that kept us from sleeping. If you desire something more affordable than Hotel Hana Maui-- I recommend you check out the Hana Kai, I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful retreat! Better than anticipated!”
Reviews.Author: JConner17
Reviews.Content: We (mid-20's couple) stayed in room #201 @ the Hana Kai Maui Resort in August 2008. We were pleasantly surprised! Our room was MUCH bigger than anticipated, and very clean. We arrived at the hotel early, and the desk staff allowed us to leave our luggage in our room while we explored Hana (the room was not cleaned yet, so we couldn't "check in early", but we were able to at least get the luggage out of the car while hiking). The room had a great view of the black sand beach, and it had a very open floor plan which allowed for great circulation of air. When booking, I was concerned about not having air conditioning, but AC is completely not necessary due to the cool breeze blowing off the Hana Bay. We LOVED sleeping with the lanai doors open, listening to the ocean. Our room was fully stocked with anything/everything we could have wanted. (Cooking supplies, shampoo/conditioner, blow-dryer, board games, etc.). Sound carried between the various rooms easliy, but not so much that it was uncomfortable. I'm not sure I would have wanted to spend my entire vacation in Hana, but we were very, very happy we spent at least a night (if we would have done it over we probably would have stayed 2-3 nights). I would recommend the Hana Kai Maui resort to friends staying in Hana for a few nights. Again, we were pleasantly surprised. Also, the pictures on the Hana Kai Maui website are very up-to-date and accurate (espicially of the views from the rooms). Enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous romantic get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: Waiulaulagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Hana to celebrate our birthdays. We were so lucky to find unit #206 available. It made the trip perfect. The condo was furnished perfectly and we loved that there were appliances, condiments, beach toys and things we didn't have to bring with us. We spent a leisurely day getting to Hana and saved the best for the rest of the trip. We found the beaches, waterfalls and hiking past Hana the even more fun and beautiful than the road there. Highlights for us at the condo were the incredible sunrise view from the lanai (worth getting up early for) and the richly remodeled bathroom with a waterfall shower head to die for. Favorite places on the trip were Koki beach, great sunset dinner at the Hana Maui hotel and the very best was the hike on Pipiwai trail up to the falls.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hana Kai #206”
Reviews.Author: lynal
Reviews.Content: Fortunately, the village of Hana helps to protect its beauty and enchantment by providing very few accommodations to outsiders. Some of the lucky, however, do manage to find a place, and a very lucky few have stumbled upon Mana Kai 206. Its special magic reflects that of Hana itself. Renovated recently by its owners into a new creation, it has really become a tropical dreamâ€”travertine tile floors, granite counters, a vessel sink in the bath that reminds one of the smooth dark stones from the beach below and an adjustable double headed shower fixture. Amazing attention to detail throughout with lots of extras in the kitchen and for the beach. After a long, tiring day exploring, a real surprise awaits the guests in the master loft-- a king size Select Comfort bed that allows the person on each side to adjust the bedâ€™s firmness to his/her liking. If they like, the guests can even take a compact DVD player up to bed with them and enjoy a DVD from their selection. The walls of the whole bungalow are covered with lahala type material that becomes a quiet tropical cocoon at night, cooled by breezes from fans and Hanaâ€™s mild evening temperatures. The owners have a real flair for decorating, and the huge photo enlargements of waterfalls, beaches, a friendly gecko and a pair of dogs are spectacular. Now whatâ€™s left . . . OH YES, the view from the lanai...a black sand beach with soft surf climbing up a gentle slope and a forest of lush green trying to crowd in all the way to the distant peninsula. This will mellow your morning coffee and your romantic candle lit dinners. My wife and I are the lucky ones who found Mana Kai 206, and we look forward to a return to this beautiful bungalow by the sea. Thank you Mark and Shayla for making the entire experience fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai Unit# 103 needs some work”
Reviews.Author: Faeriegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hana Kai Unit Unit 103 over the 4th of July weekend. The resort location is nice as all the units look over Hana Bay which was beautiful. There is a large BBQ at the bottom of the complex and it's close to many beaches nearby . We didn't have any complaints about the resort but the unit we stayed in wasn't so nice. Actually, we've stayed at nicer places in South America. It was quite shocking for us seasoned travelers. This of course, is Hawaii and my expectations are grander. First, the good points: great views, decent full size kitchen, soft sheets. Unfortunately, there were more challenging points: Bed was a queen, not a king which was unfortunate since we like to stay in resorts that have kings as my husband is 6'4" tall and queens are too short for him. Plus, you're on vacation and expect a king or cal king bed. The bed plus the pillows were also hard and uncomfortable. The furnishings were bare and outdated. The color of the decor was monotone. Carpet was installed which is absurd in an oceanfront unit and felt salty and gross under our feet, so we wore shoes inside which in Hawaii is a no no. It also looked dirty. Even though the unit had been cleaned prior to arrival, it just didn't feel clean. One of the chairs in the living room had all sorts of gross stains on it. I've added a photo to show. The shower head didn't work well and was old. The kitchen had no blender and tiny little bowl and no rice cooker which is essential in Hawaii. No beach towels, no beach toys. Our friends were staying in Unit 206 which was so nice and recently remodeled. They had all the 'toys' for the beach included in their unit like boogie boards, snorkel equipment, beach chairs and cooler. I had to go to their room to use the blender. Unit 103 has so much potential with excellent views. At this time It wasn't worth the $200 a night rate.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: Chajuram
Reviews.Content: This is the closest you will get to heaven on earth. No phones, TV, cell phones; life is simple, peaceful and fulfilling. Cook your own food in the attached kitchenette, if you like. Walk on the beautiful black sand beach attached to the hotel, sit in your balcony and fall in love with what you are looking at. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanview for you!”
Reviews.Author: Lombard955
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just stayed here for a night before we turned around and braved the road to Hana again. We had unit #203 which has been remodeled (granite counters and the like). Pros: We loved listening to the ocean all night. The stone beach out the front really amplifies the ocean sound. The bed was really comfortable. We didn't hear any of the noise that is mentioned in other reviews. Cons: The deck furnishings could have been nicer, but with the amazing view, we were willing to overlook it. The water tasted funny. We could have spent a few more nights in Hana. Tips: Eat dinner in the lounge at the Hotel Hana. Breakfast sandwiches from Tutus are a great way to start the day. Hamoa beach is fantastic! Take the hike along the lava at the nearby State park. We really wished that we'd had time to do the kayak trip. It sounds fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: CMRed
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at Hana Kai in May, 2008.They are limited choices in Hana so we felt lucky to have just found a place. The people were wonderful even before we arrived, giving us recommendations of places to eat etc. We reserved 2 rooms. As it turns out, we ended up with an upgrade for one of the rooms, we aren't sure why and didn't question it. I believe our one room was 208 (right on the end of the one building, it was great and it's patio had an amazing view, cute little kitchenette and adorable decor. BUT the upgrade to Room #503 ... this room is spectacular! It is a one bedroom with 2 bathrooms and 2 pull out couches, it has a gorgeous deck with a table and chairs set. From both the bedroom and the pull out couch, you could watch the sunrise over the waves right from your bed. The interior photos we have don't do the place justice, it was huge and adorably furnished. One word of warning, Hana, in general, seems to be a windier area of the island and a sweater would have been handy. Definitely the ideal place to stay in Hana, without a doubt, whether you get a 500 or a 200 room, it is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Hana”
Reviews.Author: rooooomie
Reviews.Content: Loved this spot. We even went to the see the pricey resort, not that great, it had no view. The Hana Kai had a much better view, lovely room with a million dollar view!!! It was great to have the kitchen with full frige, microwave, stove, and all the untensils (dishes, pots, pans, brita water filter pitcher, coffee, etc) you need provided for you. Also they provide full size shampoo, conditioner, and soap. The only downside, no ac. You get wind off the ocean with the huge doors out to the lanai. But during the day it can get toasty. We stayed in room 102 a studio. Perfect for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutTwin
Reviews.Content: I can't remember our room number other than 2nd floor, newly redecorated. We didn't see the other rooms but this one took our breath away, we walked in to the sound of the ocean waves outside our deck and slept with the glass doors opens, the wind blowing the curtains gently and felt like we were in heaven. Our only regret was not staying 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: Pete B
Reviews.Content: Great for 1 or 2 nights. Slightly dated but everything functioned well and the bed was certainly confy. Great location and very good value for Hana. Excellent ocean view from the end unit, second floor, in the back building. Room 207--I think. It's a rocky beach so the sound really travels. The ocean lulled us to sleep each night. Tip: Do drive out the extra 10 miles to the National Park Service (7 Sacred Falls). The "sacred" falls are nice but the real treat, if you're able to hike, is to cross the road and climb up to the incredible waterfalls. It's a 60-90 min. hike and goes through a magical and truly wonderful bamboo forest. The best we've ever seen. Get there and start your hike by 9a.m. and you will probably have the falls almost to yourself. Another mile down the road is where Charles Lindburgh is buried. Very Quiet....

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: winegalsf
Reviews.Content: Hana Kai is a nice place to stay for a night, maybe two after enjoying the drive to Hana. We stayed in a one bedroom unit on the second floor, with a good view of the ocean and it was very peaceful. It had a stocked kitchen and though It was a little rustic, it was also a decent price. We enjoyed a walk on the (rocky yet quaint) beach, explored Hana & as well as a day trip to the Seven Sacred pools. The weekend manager we met was very pleasant and friendly. Overall a fine alternative for the budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Hana”
Reviews.Author: llp3950
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place to stay in Hana! We were here two nights at the end of Feb 2008, as we wanted to stay and see the sights in this area and not do the drive here and back in one day. We stayed in Unit 1 right on the beach. We had a beautiful view and enjoyed the sound of the waves and ocean breezes at night. The unit was very clean and appeared to have been updated. We did not use the kitchen facilities. The lanai was the best part, very spacious and it looked out toward the beach. The condo personnel we dealt with were all very friendly and helpful. They have beach equipment (boogie boards, etc.) that you can borrow for the day. Only one complaint, the noise from people in the unit above us kept me up till late at night. I'm sure they were just walking around, but it sounded like the furniture was being rearranged for hours!! I would advise people to reserve an upper unit if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Total Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: goudagirl
Reviews.Content: When we walked into our room, we felt every bit of tension melt away. A breeze blew in from the wide doors of the lanai and a beautiful ocean view beckoned us. The decor was very neat, airy and fresh. We slept with the lanai doors open to enjoy the breeze and sound of the waves. The kitchen seemed very well equipped, although we didn't use it much. The bed was a bit firmer than we'd like, but acceptable. The only complaint we really had was being able to hear so much from the room beside us and above us. Best to request a top floor room to avoid having the sound travel through your ceiling. The beach is beautiful, but a bit too rocky to lounge on. However, there are a number of other beaches close by. The barbeque area was very nice, and we also really enjoyed the comfortable loungers overlooking the water.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai #206”
Reviews.Author: Shan123096
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hana Kai #206 for 3 nights. This condo had been newly remodeled and it is so beautiful!! It was clean and comfortable. The lanai is especially fabulous, with a view of the ocean, dining table and chairs, and comfy big chair. We left the door open with the screen closed at night to listen to the rain and the waves. We would recommend this to our friends and indeed come back!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, quiet hana”
Reviews.Author: mannaham
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here in March. We had a corner one bedroom with 2 singles in living room for our 2 teenagers with a sliding door separating our bedroom from them. The view is wonderful and the room is very nice. Food options are limited in Hana so plan ahead if you are going to be there more than 1 night. We brought breakfast with us and planned on buying fish for dinner one night but nobody was selling it that day. The Friday night buffet at the Hana Hotel was very nice and that was our night to splurge. It also includes a show at 7. The hiking at the national park beyond Hana was wonderful and was worth staying the extra nights so we weren't rushed. In addition, Homoa beach was as nice as any beach in west Maui and the day we were there it wasn't very crowded. Maui Revealed was very helpful for giving specifics on the Hana highway and make sure to check their website www.wizardpub.com where they give last minute updates that occur after they go to press. We decided not to bike down Haleakala because we learned the NPS wasn't allowing them to start at the summitt.

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai~ Our little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: snogirl
Reviews.Content: What a treat! We were to stay the night at the Waianapanapa State Park cabins and when we drove into Hana to get some dinner to cook we saw the Hana Kai had rooms available, we checked it out and decided to book the room. We drove back to the cabin to pick up our stuff. We are glad we did beautiful room and great view of the ocean cove. We stayed in room 103 in the second building but we still had a great ocean view and the sound of the waves were amazing! Plus you are forced to disconnect from the rest of the world... there is NO TV! So grab a few beers, chill out on the lani and reconnect with your loved one!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condo”
Reviews.Author: nonamePortland_OR
Reviews.Content: This place is centrally located for everything to see and do in Hana, the bed is super comfy. The Owners did a very nice job remodeling a condo to seem like a Hawaiian bungalow. It was super clean with very thoughtful amenities. Like guide books and beach towels and good olive oil in the kitchen.....they even left us flowers and chocolates for Valentine's day. if this is your first time to Hana, you'd be lucky to find this place available. We are travelers who do not mind things on the funky artsy low tech nature oriented spectrum and this condo would be great for travelers like us or a more comfort oriented traveler. You can walk out to the beach and use the little lawn area. the lanai is sweet for sunrise and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Hana”
Reviews.Author: crw25
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hana Kai for two nights in room 205. It is an ocean view studio with a nice, large lanai. This room has a loft, but no way to get up there. It is not usable space. The room is for 2 people. The unit has been updated. The appliances are new and the shower has new tile. The bed is very comfortable. The view is very good. Hana Kai is a very good option for Hana. The two restaurants are pricey and usually require reservations. The Ranch restaurant is not open everyday. The General Store closes at 7pm and the small grocery store closes at 7:30pm. It is nice to know that there is a refergerator and stove and microwave in your room, in case you are hungry. So I recommend bring a few grocery items and getting milk and ice cream when you arrive. A quart of milk in the store was $3. Ice cream was pricey, too. We bought a few of the "Plate Lunches". They are big enough to share. They are really good and about $8 each. The hiking trails are often muddy. We brought old shoes along. I am glad we did not try to drive to Hana and back in one day. It would have been exhausting. Staying in Hana allowed us to enjoy a full day of exploring and a chance to rest before driving back.

Reviews.Title: “I wish we could have stayed more than 2 nights.”
Reviews.Author: Hill1727
Reviews.Content: The Hana Kai was a delightful place to stay in Hana. I absolutely loved our room and the location right on Hana Bay couldn't be more perfect. We stayed in unit 202 and I would highly recommend this newly remodeled room. The bathroom was very cool with it's fresh new design and the shower was absolutely wonderful to come back to after muddy adventurous days in Hana. The small kitchen was the perfect size for me. I actually prefer not having a huge kitchen on vacation and find it unnecessary. This unit was very nice because it has a bed on the main level and another in the spacious loft. Before we arrived we were a little nervous about the lack of AC because my boyfriend is ALWAYS hot, but it was not an issue at all. The trade winds blew in off of our lani and the sound of the ocean was blissfully relaxing. Speaking of the Lani, it was very spacious and our ocean view was wonderful. My only complaint is the noise that travels in through the front door and how easy it is to hear your neighbors because everyone's windows are open. It's not that the walls are thin but that everyone is keeping their windows and lanis open so sound can sometimes travel too easily. The front door is a screen with wooden shades that you can close but it's not exactly sound proof from the noise of people traveling up and down the stairs and entering and exiting their rooms. The grounds were very well maintained and the black sand beach was perfect for late night star gazing. All of the staff was very friendly and extremely helpful in every way. I highly recommend this place if you are staying in Hana the price is reasonable especially for all that you get.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: loopstravel
Reviews.Content: Paradise found ... fancy it is not ... but if you want fancy then Hana is probably not your speed anyway ... we have stayed here many times ... it is always clean & confortable, great views & comfortable arrangements ... the 1 bedrooms are very large, full kitchen most equiped with everything you would need to serve a full meal ... and its a bargain price ... a weekend here with no TV is what everyone needs a few times a year!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the better options in Hana for the price”
Reviews.Author: dfarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 205 which is an efficiency unit in the 2nd building back from the bay. This building sits higher on the hill so you have very nice views of the bay looking over the closer building. Our unit, although a bit dated, was clean and comfortable and exactly what we needed for our one night stay in Hana. The bed was comfortable and the sound of the waves and nice breeze was delightful. This is an older wooden structure so there was a fair amount of noise from adjacent units. There is also parking lot both in front and behind this building so you get a fair amount of those annoying remote doorlock horn beeps and door/trunk slams. I'm sure many enjoy the black sand beach but it reminded me too much of a NE PA strip mine site. It's only about a 5 minute drive to Hotel Hana Maui where for $50/pp we enjoyed a great dinner. Considering the limited options in Hana and the fact that they will rent for single nights this is a great place to spend the night after driving the Road To Hana.

Reviews.Title: “#206 of this hotel rocks!”
Reviews.Author: nycbm
Reviews.Content: We have spent three days at this lovely condo just after Christmas of 2007. Had a great time at this very nicely renovated condo (#206). Made me wish I had the same kitchen and bath at my place. Lanai with a table for romantic dinners and awesome sunset views. I am not a good writer, but this is one of the very few places I would come back to from New York.

Reviews.Title: “WOW--- What a place”
Reviews.Author: beachbumb7
Reviews.Content: We had a week to spend in Maui on our recent vacation and decided to drive to Hana ( not bad drive, as you might have been told) ! We spent 3 gorgious days and nights a unit 206 which had totally been redecorated from floor to ceiling. We love the king size sleep comfort bed and all the new appliances. My husband was so happy to have a desk and internet access as well so he could keep up with his business some what! The kitchen was so well equipped I felt like I was at home and not in a rental place at all! Thanks for remembering a winebottle opener too. The view is wonderful and we ate our meals mostly on the patio and enjoyed that part so much! Hana is a place no one should miss and the jungle and plants are so different from the rest of Maui !! Don't miss the sunrises and the art galleries ----- Cute "old" general store as well !! Hated to leave for Minnesota and the cold winter. We will be back to Hana Kai 206 for sure as soon as we get a chan Thank you vreny from Apple valley, MN

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: VS09
Reviews.Content: The Hana-Kai is a great place to stay.... on the Hana bay with beautiful views from your balcony... we saw amazing sunrises while sipping our coffees...The staff is friendly, we stayed in 202...the room was very clean. They do not have a restaurant onsite but we ate at the Hana-Maui and Hana Ranch. The Hana-Maui has a great buffet with hula-music on fridays for $50 per person ! awesome!! The Hana Kai is where I will stay the next time we are in Hana !

Reviews.Title: “Scenic Location ~ On the Pacific ~ Quiet Setting”
Reviews.Author: julymystery
Reviews.Content: Hana Kai Maui Resort My husband and I stayed one night at the Hana Kai last April. Our trip to Hana was a side trip on our week long visit in Maui. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hana Kai as did many others who previously signed the guest diary of room #2. Upon opening the door and entering the room we were greeted by a breath-taking view of the deep blue sky and blue Pacific waves crashing against the black sand. The glass door wall was open and you could hear the surf. Wonderful! The room was spotless and fresh. We sat on the lanai and watched the waves and surfers. There is no TV nor is one needed. Very relaxing. We slept on a Murphy bed which we found to be quite comfortable. At night we kept the door wall open and slept with a fresh sea breeze and the sound of the surf. Kitchenette was clean and was nicely furnished with basic cooking essentials. Hana Kai is a great place to experience Hawaii without the commercialism and tourism. Hana Kai is more than lodging. With its attractive setting and close proximity to the ocean, it is an experience. Would definitely stay here again, next time longer. Side note is we found the drive beyond Hana far more scenic than drive to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Place !”
Reviews.Author: RUFUSTFIREFLY26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hana Kai Motel 2nd on our Honeymoon stay in Maui. We had chosen this hotel as it was much cheaper than the other option of staying at the Hotel Hana in this area. We wanted to stay in Hana after doing the Drive To Hana, as after reading many reviews of people so tired by the end of their day driving to Hana it ruined the experience, we thought it would be nice to be able to crash in Hana and then wake up the next day and finish the other attractions in the area. Hana has a clearly different feel/style than the other side of the island (ie.Lahaina). Hana is a small village like area, with only 2 general stores for buying food/groceries/etc. There are a few places to eat out, but the best restaurant we found was at the Hana Hotel (very close to hana kai hotel but very expensive). The views and experience of staying at the Hana Kai outweighed the negatives , although, would be remiss if did not mention that there certainly are some negatives for Hana Kai. For starters, be prepared for a very rustic feel. Although it does have a full kitchen/bath , no appliances are high end. The microwave did'nt work, the shower hardly worked, no a/c, no tv,no radio. Highly recommend stopping at the general store and buying or bringing your own playing cards/board games. Maybe bring your own ipod/radio too cuz there is no music/tv to play at all. No iron / ironing board, room service,fresh towels. Seems like a lot of negatives but this stay was pretty fun. Hana is a great place - but you can't expect much from the local lodgings. Even the high priced Hotel Hana has no tv or a/c. It's an experience - recommend staying for at least a day - close to Oheo Gulch, Waipanapa state park, Lava Tube. All lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at the top of hana go back!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetripsStLouis
Reviews.Content: the resort was beautiful but no one warned us that they have alot of thieves in hana. not so much in town but on the way to the resort. we were on our way up hana hwy and had plans to stay for 4 nights of our honeymoon at the resort. we stopped at a beach along the way, we were robbed of our luggage. yes the car was locked and we were on our way to the resort so we had everything with us. But that wasnt the worst of it, no police in hana really cared to help us, we had a big hole in our convertible car from the knife the theif put there. alot of rain in hana so we only stayed one night because we had to turn the car in the next day. no car rental in hana, no restaraunt that we could go into with the beach clothes we had on and only one store to purchase attire which wasnt open till the next day. the resort wouldnt let us eat in the nice restaraunt even if our clothes were stolen. but we could purchase a $100 aloha shirt from their gift shop if we wanted to. HA so we ate at the local baseball game which was the hi-light of the trip. do not expect the locals to welcome you warmly.
