The resort employees were very nice and the room was beautiful but if they dont get a handle on the theives it will ruin this resort. I didnt feel safe in my room after that and with no air conditioning it was a little scary to leave the windows open. so my advice is find a hotel at the bottom of hana leave all your belongings there locked up and drive up and back down hana. also note: this happens alot in hana maui (thieves breaking into your convertible so beware)

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandLuvhawaii
Reviews.Content: Hana Kai was awesome! The staff was so welcoming and helpful when we arrived, after our long drive from Kaanapali! The room we orignally booked had some issues, so instead of cramming our party of 5 into a small room, they actually give us two different rooms....so we had plenty of space! The no phone, no tv, no air conditioning concept was a bit of a shocker at first - but trust me it was so appreciated the longer we stayed there. The breeze from the ocean was amazing and the seclusion of the resort on the beach is so unique and well worth the drive on "The Road to Hana"! The rooms were well kept and the resort is very peaceful. The resort is defintely a kid-free zone - so if you need entertainment for your kids, you may find more at another resort. If you are looking for a beautifully relaxing place to put your feet up and enjoy a cocktail after your day long drive....this is the ultimate place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in paradise”
Reviews.Author: kkic04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Hana Kai Maui on July 15. We weren't sure what to expect upon our arrival in Hana, but were so happy to stay here! There are limited accommodations in Hana and we didn't want to stay at the main hotel, which was costly. We found this place online and the Trip Advisor reviews were helpful & accurate. There are only 18 units between the two buildings. Our studio was in the back building, but we could still see the ocean from our first floor balcony. Our room contained a bed, table and chairs, a small, full kitchen, and a bathroom. No phones or tv, but you won't miss them. (there is a courtesy phone near the BBQ/picnic area) We did have a ceiling fan in our room. At night, we left the balcony doors open and listened to the waves. We found the staff very friendly, although we only interacted with them when we checked in/out. There was a large family split up between a number of rooms while we were there, but the staff told us at check in they informed the family of the "quiet hours" and everything was fine. The grounds are beautiful with koi ponds and direct access to the black rock beach. I don't think you can swim here, but its absolutely beautiful and there are beaches a short drive away with swimming, I think. Hana is definitely a sleepy town with one general store where you can buy groceries to cook in your unit. Since we only stayed one night, we opted for dinner at the only restaurant, located at Hotel Hana Maui. We had a fabulous dinner sitting outside of the bar, opting not to eat in the formal dining room (you can get the same menu in the bar). I recommend their lemonade! We would definitely recommend the Hana Kai Maui for a peaceful, relaxing stay in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhhh”
Reviews.Author: stevendm
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about staying at a place with no air conditioning, but that was not a concern. The windows open and you get pretty good flow through ventilation. We stayed in unit 1. Nice suite with a bedroom, living area and large lanai overlooking the beach. it was reasonably clean and the kitchen had everything we needed to cook. I advise stopping at Safeway in Kahaliu and cooking at the hotel. The restaurants in Hana are expensive. There is a shared bbq pit for the entire hotel (about 20 units). It is fueled by propane so there is no need to buy charcoal like we did, you won't need it. The management was very nice and quite helpful. Would I stay there again? Heck yea.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: havegpswilltravel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful ocean view from our upper level balcony. We had totally missed that there was a full kitchen in our unit before arriving and then found a local store to purchase dinner items to cook.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: hartmann4
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying here but everything went better than I had anticipated. I called a few months ahead to book room 207 for one night, since I had seen pictures from another review and knew it was a corner upper unit. Everyone I dealt with for check in/out was very nice and courteous. The grounds were very lush and the outside of the complex appeared well maintained. The inside could use a makeover but was adequate. The kitchen was well stocked with everything we needed. Since there is no A/C, the windows have to stay open to get the breeze which also means you do hear all noises around you. All was quiet pretty early (8p-9p) so going to sleep wasn't a problem. The bathroom was the biggest downfall as it seemed dirty and badly needed to be remodeled. If you're only staying one night in Hana, or you're on a budget, this is a decent place.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: LudlowRandall
Reviews.Content: We vacationed on Maui in April,2006. We stayed with friends and rented a car to tour the island on our own. W e took the road toHana trip and enjoyed every minuteof it. When we arrived in Hana and needed a place to stay, we just pulled into the drive of th Hana Kai and asked if there were any vacancies. We were given a room with an effeciency kitchen, full bath and a bedroom with a lanai with the most beautiful view. No TV, no telephone, just ocean views and sea sounds. If I ever have the oppurtunity to return to Maui, you can rest assured I will make a trip to Hana and stay in the Hana Kai, and I will make reservations before I go to make sure I can stay there. Thank you for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “In touch with old school windward Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: wmozart5
Reviews.Content: We spent one night on Hana so our drive along that famed highway could be more leisurely, as well as give us a chance to bask in the moist, sleepy pace of Hana. The hotel itself is very modest by any standard, rustic even, but clean enough and charming in its own way. The room reminded me of a small cabin, sort of. We got a good deal on one of the central rooms overlooking the rocky beach, since our one-night stay serendipitously coincided with two longer rentals before and after. Great view of the water and beach, though it's of course vastly different than the sandy beaches of the leeward side. We found many Portuguese men-of-war scattered on the beach, quite nifty looking creatures. Mosquitoes and other critters (there was neat looking spider in our room that we put outside on the terrace for its own safety) are not uncommon, so squeamish folks may want to stay elsewhere. You're definitely closer to nature here than the typical touristy spots that abound in Hawaii. Didn't have much interaction with the staff, but they were pleasant enough. A good place to stay overall, given the few choices in Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: fresquez
Reviews.Content: I stayed one nite with my 2 teenage kids at this resort. Beautiful. I was glad it didn't have a phone or TV because it gave us time to bond with each other again. We were lulled to sleep by the waves and woke early to see the sunrise. What a wonderful experience. I'd stay again. We also ate at the Ranch, great food!

Reviews.Title: “Truly about the view -- place to get away from it all”
Reviews.Author: sanfran,norcal
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are accurate. This is a beautiful location and a different view than you would get elsewhere in Hana (better view than the fancier resort in town). Feels like looking out on a South Pacific island beach. The beach is rocks and great for strolling (when it is not raining). Continue along the beach around toward the point to really explore and eventually meet up with the old kings highway trail (a little hard to find). Swimming is 2 minute drive down the road at the main Hana beach. I wouldn't call it reasonable given that it is >$200 per night after taxes for the 1BRs. But the studios are just as nice (and perhaps better for two people since you wil have a view from your bed while the 1BRs has the bed in a back room with a patio looking o the street). But if no studios are available, this is still worth it. Our only complaint is that although the kitchen is well stocked with cooking appliances, utensils, etc. it does not have any of the main things one needs as a traveler who is cooking -- namely olive oil and salt and pepper. Those would have been nice since the key to this place is cooking in and eating on the deck or using their BBQs down on the beach. Ask for a room in the lower building since it is literally right on the beach (but there might not be any studios there). We stayed on the right corner of the top building which was fine but if we were more to the left we would be looking too much over the lower building. Staff is OK but not super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place! Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AmyDDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hana Kai for one night during a week long stay on Maui - and it was by far the most romantic, charming and peaceful part of our visit. We wished we could have stayed longer. You feel like you've left the whole world behind. The waves crashing on the beach was the best sound I've ever fallen asleep to. We highly recommend making a stop in Hana and staying here when on Maui. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “This is the spot”
Reviews.Author: Miya_Vida
Reviews.Content: This was the best place that I stayed at in years. If you want to get away from everything and have a quite week this is the SPOT. right on the water and well kept units. Daily maid service a laundry facility and a BBQ erea thats open to all guest. Im telling you you need to check this out.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of the trip”
Reviews.Author: pencilthinmoustache
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Maui for a week last January and had some great experiences and some that were mediocre at best. By far, the Hana Kai Maui was the highlight of the trip. We spent our last two days on the island driving the road to Hana, used the travel book Maui Revealed, and stopped at a few of the great hiking spots - that guide book is a must for Hana. Prior to heading up to Hana we spent a couple of days at a good B&B in Lahaina (Penny's Place - good) and a couple days in Kihei (I will never return to Kihei it is one big stucco strip mall with no appeal other than its proximity to Waillea.) Also, got a massage at the Grand Waillea, I will remember their spa for the rest of my life -- spectacular. Check out the Web site. But, back to the hotel -- we arrived at the hotel late in the day after stopping for a smoked pork sandwich at the little collection of shops just before the Wanannappa State Park, delicious, I can't stop thinking about them. The hotel isn't beautiful, or even 3 star, but the location can not be beat, even at the Hotel Hana. We spent hours sitting watching the sky grow dark and listening to the rocks roll as the waves came in and out. One thing I will say about Hana Bay is that it is not swimmable in the area near the hotel. Unlike at the state park about twenty minutes before you arrive in Hana, Hana Bay has a beach made of small black rocks, not sand. You really can't even walk on it without shoes on. That said, listening to the rocks on the beach as the water comes in and out is a unique and lovely experience and the beaches you can swim in are close enough. The room we had was in the building closest to the water and we were in the corner room on the bottom floor, by far the best view in the hotel with an enormous lanai. The room was very big, the kitchen really was fully stocked, and the bed was soft enough. The shower is a bit odd as it has a window that faces the outdoor hallway and someone could look in on you while you shower if you forget to close the slats, a little disconcerting. We had dinner at the Hotel Hana and it was the best meal of the whole trip. I've also eaten at Roy's, Ruth's Chirs, Kobe, and Vino as all the travel guides suggested. The are good, but the Hotel Hana was outstanding. The next morning we drove the opposite way to leave, stopped at the Seven Sacred Pools then over and around to the Tedeshi Winery. This often skipped side of the island is sooooo cool! It looks like you have landed on Mars, or the desserts of Southern Utah. The guide books make it sound as if this road is really rugged but our Chrysler did just fine. The Winery is charming and the wine is good for the price point. I would recommend taking this drive if you have the time to spend on your way back from Hana it is a whole different side to Maui and you could have the road all to yourself for miles at a time. Also, we stopped on the way to O'heo Gulch and ate lunch in the front yard of the guy with the sign that says "Best Plate Lunch on Hana." It seems a bit strange eating in the guys front yard, but he doesn't lie, his chicken was out of this world, and the macaroni salad was the perfect consistency. Give him a try if he is there when you are. Also, make sure you take all the side trips through the small towns on the ride up to Hana. The first time I made the trip to Hana I didn't and missed out on some of the best parts of the journey. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: ms_aimee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few nights during our honeymoon and had a great time. We stayed in the building closest to the ocean, in a room with a huge balcony and so close to the water you felt you could touch it. We spent lots of time on the balcony eating breakfast and dinner, and took advantage of the full kitchen in the unit to heat up pizza, make steaks, and sautee veggies (which is a real money saver if you've seen the restaurant prices on the islands!). There's not much to do in Hana itself - one of the "attractions" is the general store, which should tell you something right there - but it is a great place to relax if that's what you came to do. This property definitely eased us into relaxation mode!

Reviews.Title: “Hana Kai-good prices”
Reviews.Author: kitty40502
Reviews.Content: We stayed in #5. Priceless view! Price was much cheaper than Hana Maui Resort. No restaurant on site, that's the only downfall.

Reviews.Title: “Well Priced Getaway with Nice Features”
Reviews.Author: TravlingBard
Reviews.Content: The Hana Kai was a pleasant surprise. We wanted a romantic yet affordable stopping place for one night. The ocean view studio on the top story of the 2d building away from the water was perfect. It had a beautiful view and one could hear the surf all night. The walls are thin yet single wall construction is common in Maui and feels authentic, if not quite as private. The bathroom was beautifully renovated and the patio, inviting. A fully equipped kitchen completed the place. We'd love to stay a week on our next visit to Hana. Staff service with aloha.

Reviews.Title: “not a resort but delightful”
Reviews.Author: nenaghgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for a night, and at the time it was still called a "guesthouse." After making my reservation I had some apprehensions since the staff was not very welcoming on the phone, and it was pretty cheap, so I just didn't know what to expect. When I arrived it exceeded my expectations. The room was very spacious (more like a condo - includes a kitchen, living room, and verandah overlooking the ocean). It was very clean, breezy, and delightful. It is a small town, so don't come here looking for glamour or things to do - it is very relaxing. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by the Hana Kai and enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of my trip”
Reviews.Author: MaiaJanus
Reviews.Content: We planned the Hana drive, but wanted to stay a night. Got a room reserve the night before, we drove otu there and was flabergasted at how wonderful the studio was. Clean, romantic, quiet. When i think of my maui trip, i think of hana kai.

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I loved it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here's the deal - If you love being with the person you're with, and you don't mind a break from Maui's crowded resorts, then I highly recommend this place. Most people drive the road to Hana and back in one day. My new wife and I (we are in our eary 30s)decided to find a place in Hana, and our 2 nights there were the best part of our 8 day honeymoon. It's nice being pampered at the 4 and 5 star resorts in Kaanapali or Wailea, but Hana was the first place we felt like we were seeing the "real" Hawaii. In the morning we could hear roosters and peacocks on one side of the road and the crashing waves from the beach on the other. The beach at sunrise is stunning. There are two small general stores that are a 5 minute drive from the condo. There is also affordable horseback riding through the Hotel Hana - also a 3-5 minute drive from Hana Kai Resort. Hamoa Beach (Bay?) is 5-10 minutes from here - a gorgeous stretch of beach. Yes, it's a good idea to keep all of your food wrapped up in the fridge (we cleaned up every crumb meticulously), because there are obviously critters roaming around - but we never saw a single insect in our room for 2 days. The place is very clean and relaxing. Sitting on our big Lanai (we were in room 203), we felt like we were in a Corona commercial. I loved our 2 nights here - we were asleep early and awake early every day. Don't go to Hana looking for night-life. But if you want to relax and get away from noise and did I mention relax....?? Loved the Hana Kai resort and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to get away”
Reviews.Author: CalBears
Reviews.Content: There's nothing impressive about the grounds of this little hotel. The decorative pool is green with algae and the building looks really plain from the outside. But everything else was great. PRICE. The price was pretty reasonable. After paying $300/night for a room at a hotel in Kaanapali, I didn't mind paying half of that for a one bedroom unit with it's own lanai and a newly renovated kitchen. Our unit was on the second floor (in the building closer to the road than the beach). It was nicely furnished (and I'm picky about decor). The kitchen was clean, modern, and well-equipped. Based on the previous reviews, it looks like some units may not be as well-furnished as the one we got. VIEW. Fantastic. The ocean is visible from the lanai and the living room and the kitchen. I didn't mind doing the dishes. LOCATION. It's right on a pebble beach. You may not want to swim, but it's nice for walking or for sitting and contemplating about a move to Hana. There's a great beach nearby called Hamoa beach. It's a great place to swim and relax. (The guests from the Hana Maui use this beach). HANA ITSELF. It was the best part of our 9 day visit to Maui. It truly is special and a world away. A FEW TIPS: Eat dinner at the Hana Maui hotel and go to the Paniolo bar to listen to the band. Buy some food supplies and eat dinner on your own lanai. It's very romantic and easy on the wallet. BUT, make sure to use bug spray specially at night (there were mosquitoes). There are no TVs, no phones (inside the hotel), no internet. If you must have these things, then perhaps a day visit to Hana is enough. The locals we met were friendly and courteous. Just be respectful and aware about where you park.

Reviews.Title: “No frills what so ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Maui and we decided to stay at Hana for two days out of our 6 day trip. After reading the reviews and various travel guides we decided to stay at the Hana Kai Maui resort. It is a good deal for the area but not that great of a place. We could hear all of our neighbors (including bathrooms) and every conversation in the parking lot. Now, what to expect: no AC , noisy rickety fan (It never cooled our room), old kitchen, a few dishes, and a ton of bugs outside so no open windows. Overall the furnishings were old and in need of replacement. The major items were clean like the toilet and towels but the sheets and pillows were questionable. The premises and patio/lanai are nice. The best part of the Han Kai is that each room has its own guest book and includes great stories from previous patrons, I ony wish they had gone onto trip advisor to share thier wisdom (it was too late for us so read on). People talk about how wonderful Hana is, but my wife and I do not agree. It is pretty but the locals treat you not as a guest but as a nuisance (excluding Hotel Hana Staff which are being paid handsomely to treat you nice). I was really shocked how far it could go as one set of Hotel guests had their car pelted with cans and cursed at when they tried to park next to the softball field. Apparently it was a locals only event(call the Hana Kai and ask). If you like to experience old small towns with small town attitudes set against a beautiful tropical backdrop then Hana and the Hana Kai Maui Resort is the place to stay. Otherwise, I would highly recommend driving in early (bring your own food) and hiking the major sites and driving back to stay somewhere comfortable, clean, and friendly that appreciates your business.

Reviews.Title: “No Pretense - No Luxury, but perfect”
Reviews.Author: TVTravel
Reviews.Content: If you want high-tech gadgets like televisions, telephones, air-conditioning, internet access, dishwashers, and garbage disposals DON'T stay at the Hana Kai. In fact, I had to climb the stairs to the 2nd floor just to get my celphone to work (Verizon, the only cellular service in Hana). If you like to be lulled to sleep by pounding surf and don't need room service and mints on your pillow, this IS the place! I've done the one day, drive-to-Hana,-look-around-and-leave trip many times. This trip, my wife and I decided to stay for a week. What a difference! All morning, the town and the cool things to do are almost lonely. Then, about 11am or noon - depending on where you are - a parade of rental cars invades. It's almost a comical sight. Staying in Hana gives a great head start for your daily activities. The Hana Kai offers a free night if you stay 5 off their already reasonable rates ($120/night for a studio with ocean view). You'll probably spend the saving dining at the ultra-expensive Hana Hotel, which is the only place in town that serves dinner. First night, my wife and I did their fixed price special which came to $200 for two (including wine). OUCH! The second night we did salads, appetizers, and wine: $100 for two. Then we discovered the bar menu, and ate the rest of the week without needing to take out a 2nd mortgage. "Maui Revealed" is a book so good many locals would like to lynch the author for tipping off the tourists to their favorite "secret" spots. We found it invaluable in planning each day's activity. The book's only serious error is their liking for Tutu's as a decent lunch spot. I had the worst plate lunch I've ever tried to eat there! Much better to patronize whatever guy has a BBQ set up on his front lawn that day (and it varies), or buy banana bread at one of the various stands. Be sure to buy groceries in Kahului before doing the Hana Highway drive. You can get the absolute basics like milk and POG from the 2 stores (Hasegawa's and the Hana Ranch), but the meat in both is extremely limited, expensive, and somewhat suspicious looking. Late in the day, local fishermen congregate at Koki Beach to drink beer and sell whatever they caught, so if you want to combine local color with a gamble that they had a good day, you can find your dinner there and take it back to the condo to cook. They'll even filet your selection if you ask. This is supposed to be a review of the Hana Kai, not the Hana region, so I'll finish by describing the place and its features. They have a website with 360 degree views of the units (which is how we found the Hana Kai) so you can get a good idea of it from there. Our studio unit had a queen size bed, ceiling fan which kept the unit a perfect temperature at night, a small round table, very small kitchen (no dishwasher or garbage disposer) with limited selection of cooking utensils, coffee maker (coffee supplied), and a nice lanai with big table, chairs, and a view of Hana Bay complete with daily sunrise. Daily maid service with fresh towels is included. They ask that you do your own dishes, but the maid will clean up whatever you didn't get to. The office is open from 8 to ?, but a resident takes over night manager duties to give out keys to late arrivals. They provide beach towels and mats upon request, have a couple of lounge chairs on their lawn and a community barbeque area. No swimming in the weird little pool. The beach that the condo fronts is a large rock one, with pounding surf. Enter the water there at your own risk! It's a 5 minute walk to Hana Bay Beach Park, where you'll swimmable water, and the notorious Tutu's snack bar. Hana Kai offers a no-pretense, no-luxury place to hang your hat while exploring Hana. I'm going back!

Reviews.Title: “Great view in peaceful Hana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved unit #2, which has the closest view of the ocean on the property. Waking up to the sunrise at Hana Kai and off to Venus Pool and the hike up Pipou trail was one of the best days of my life. We made dinner both nights in the newly renovated kitchen and ate on the deck overlooking the black rock beach. Incredible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hana--Remote and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Belle51
Reviews.Content: After "surviving" the Hana Highway, we stayed two nights here. The location couldn't have been better. Our lanai looked out upon a spectacular black sand beach. We went to sleep to the sounds of the ocean and awoke to the sounds of the birds. There is no television, telephone or air conditioning at this resort--that took a bit of getting used to. We stayed in Unit #202. The kitchen could have been better equipped and the bedding should have been newer, but you couldn't beat the location or the view. Hana offers peace and quiet in a lovely tropical paradise. Next time, we will stay longer!
